concupitus: <entryFree id="n9952" type="main" key="concu^pi_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concŭpītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from concupisco.</entryFree>
concurator: <entryFree id="n9953" type="main" key="concu_ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-cūrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joint-guardian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:10:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:24:section=1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 24, § 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concurialis: <entryFree id="n9954" type="gloss" key="concu_ri^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-cūrĭālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the same curia</hi>, Inscr. Fea Fast. Cons. p. 23, n. 46.</sense></entryFree>
concuro: <entryFree id="n9955" type="hapax" key="concu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-cūro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n9955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to care for suitably, attend to</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concurro: <entryFree id="n9956" type="main" key="concurro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-curro</orth>, <itype>curri, cursum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n9956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. redupl.</hi> concucurrit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:33" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 33</bibl> Duker <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: concucurrisse, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 901</bibl> P., and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 15</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12</bibl> Oud., and Ind. Flor. s. h. v. Duker), <pos>v. n.</pos> </sense><sense id="n9956.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To run together</hi> (of several persons), <hi rend="ital">to come</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assemble together in multitudes, to rush</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flock together in crowds</hi> (very freq., and class.). </sense><sense id="n9956.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n9956.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota Italia concurret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:5:section=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 5, § 16</bibl></cit>: video hac tempestate concurrisse omnis adversarios, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 10, p. 901</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">concurrunt jussu meo plures uno tempore librarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnes, ut mos est, concurrerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:26:section=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 26, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet concurrant omnes plebei philosophi, nihil tam eleganter explicabunt, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>unite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:23:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 23, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi concurrerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 60:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 60, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concurrite, concurrite, cives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: contionem inprimis advocari jubet; <cit><quote lang="la">summā cum expectatione concurritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9956.4" n="2" level="3"> Designating the place from which, or the place or purpose to or for which: <cit><quote lang="la">non solum qui in urbe erant, sed etiam undique ex agris concurrerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undique gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 321</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concurrunt laeti mi obviam cupedinarii omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: ad hos (sc. Druides) magnus adulescentium numerus disciplinae<cb n="CONC" />  causā concurrit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eum magnae copiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 56:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 56, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eum homines omnium ordirum corruptissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:48:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 48, 7</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">ad curiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 7, 18</bibl></cit> (corresp. to convolare ad Rostra); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:60:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 60, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum tuam cuncta civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:31:section=80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 31, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad arma milites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 39</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad non dubiam mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:37:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 37, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad auxilium sociae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 663</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum dedit, ut ad me restituendum Romam concurrerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes concurrerunt ad Perdiccam opprimendum,</quote> <trans><tr>united together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phoc. 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem audiendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 32</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concurritur undique ad commune incendium restinguendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concurrendum ad curiam putare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad arma concurri oporteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex proximis castellis eo concursum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concursum ad curiam esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:60:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 60, 1</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 16</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n9956.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to run in attendance upon, to accompany</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est quibus Eleae concurrit palma quadrigae, as it were,</quote> <trans><tr>follows him on foot, accompanies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 9</bibl></cit> (4, 8), 17.—</sense><sense id="n9956.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> = confugere, <hi rend="ital">to run for refuge</hi> or <hi rend="ital">help, to take refuge</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ad C. Aquilium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 16, 53</bibl></cit> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla sedes, quo concurrant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne darem perditis civibus hominem, quo concurrerent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interea servitia repudiabat (Catilina), opibus conjurationis fretus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 56:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 56, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 19, 1, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9956.7" n="2" level="3"> Of words, as under military command: <cit><quote lang="la">ante enim circumscribitur mente sententia confestimque verba concurrunt, quae mens eadem ... statim dimittit, ut suo quodque loco respondeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:59:200" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 59, 200</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9956.8" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To run upon one another, to meet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dash together</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n9956.9" n="A" level="2"> Of corporeal objects. </sense><sense id="n9956.10" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">concurrunt nubes ventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 97</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 116</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne prorae concurrerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 30, 4</bibl></cit> (al. prorā; cf. Weissenb. ad loc.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 42, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 663</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediis concurrere in undis (montes, viz., the Symplegades),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 62</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 11, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concurrere montes duo inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 83, 85, § 199</bibl></cit>: actor cum stetit in scaenā, concurrit dextera laevae (viz., <hi rend="ital">in applauding</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 205</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">labra concurrunt,</quote> <trans><tr>draw together, close</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 11:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 11, 2</bibl></cit>: os concurrit, id. Ira, 3, 15, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 2, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:121" default="NO">11, 3, 121</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of letters and words: <cit><quote lang="la">aspere concurrunt litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:43:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 43, 172</bibl></cit> (opp. diduci); so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:45:154" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 45, 154</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9956.11" n="2" level="3"> In partic., milit. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to rush together in hostility, to engage in combat, to join battle, to fight</hi> (most freq. in the histt.); constr. <hi rend="ital">inter se, cum aliquo, adversus, in, contra aliquem, alicui</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9956.12" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Inter se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concurrunt equites inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 25</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:51:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 51, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 18, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:489" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 489</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 436</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9956.13" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Cum aliquo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hoc concurrit ipse Eumenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 4, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:70:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 70, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 87</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9956.14" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Adversus, in</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">contra aliquem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">recenti milite adversus fessos longo itinere concurrerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 1, 6</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 97:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 97, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:1:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 1, 10</bibl>: equites contra tantam multitudinem audacissime concurrunt, <hi rend="ital">run upon, against</hi>, etc., Auct. B. Afr. 6.—</sense><sense id="n9956.15" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Alicui</hi> (freq. in the poets): <cit><quote lang="la">audet viris concurrere virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 493</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 89</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 595 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (equitibus) cum inpigre, Numidae concurrissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 15, 7</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: repente Antonius in aciem suas copias de vico produxit et sine morā concurrit, Galb. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 30, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum infestis signis concurrunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 60:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 60, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 7, 9 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex insidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 25, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 11, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutuis vulneribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 7:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 7, 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi propius ventum est, utrimque magno clamore concurritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 53:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 53, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:40:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 40, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 7</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus has concurrentis belli minas, legati vallum murosque firmabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 22 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n9956.16" n="b" level="4"> Not in war; in the jurists, <hi rend="ital">to make the same claim, enter into competition with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si non sit, qui ei concurrat, habeat solus bonorum possessionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:1:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hereditatem fratri concurrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:2:16" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pignus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:4:7" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 20, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: in pignore, ib.—</sense><sense id="n9956.17" n="c" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (rare): in tantā causarum varietate cum alia colligantur vel ipsa inter se concurrant,<cb n="CONC" />  vel in diversum ambiguitate ducantur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concurrit illinc publica, hinc regis salus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 830" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 830</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9956.18" n="B" level="2"> Of abstract objects (occurrences, circumstances, points of time, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to meet, concur, fall out at the same time, happen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa concurrunt simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">concurrunt multae opiniones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot verisimilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res contrariae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:10:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista casu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:68:141" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 68, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ut concurrant omnia, optabile est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:14:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe concurrunt aliquorum bene de me meritorum inter ipsos contentiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:32:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 32, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid tale accidisset, ut non concurrerent nomina,</quote> <trans><tr>that the reciprocal accounts do not meet, become due on the same day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsalia in idem tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concurrit actio legis Aquiliae et injuriarum,</quote> <trans><tr>to have place together, to be coincident</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:5" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 9, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9956.19" n="2" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to accord, agree with</hi> (in jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">concurrit cum veritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:2:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum summā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:30:53" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 29, 30, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
concursatio: <entryFree id="n9957" type="main" key="concursa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concursātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>concurso</etym>. <sense id="n9957.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A running together, a disorderly meeting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum multā concursatione (populi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:69:242" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 69, 242</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9957.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: inventus est ordo in stellis ... cedo tandem qui sit ordo aut quae concursatio somniorum? <hi rend="ital">what coincidence?</hi> i. e. <hi rend="ital">what concert of motion</hi> that can express a design? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:71:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 71, 146</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9957.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A running upon, pushing against one another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concursatio in obscuro incidentium aliorum in alios incertum fecerat, an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9957.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A running about, going to and fro</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ego hujus lacrimas et concursationes proferam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:30:section=75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 30, § 75</bibl></cit> Zumpt ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">et in Albaniā et Seplasiā quae concursatio percunctantium, quid, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:34:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 34, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerorum illa concursatio nocturna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Libonis et Hypsaei non obscura concursatio et contentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mulierum) concursatio incerta nunc hos nunc illos sequentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 40, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:49:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 49, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decemviralis,</quote> <trans><tr>a travelling over the provinces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concursationes ad divitias euntium sapiens securus laetusque ridebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 17:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 17, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9957.4" n="2" level="3"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">the skirmishing of light-armed troops</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 34, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9957.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an anxious, troubled restlessness, anxiety</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exagitatae mentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 3:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 3, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
concursator: <entryFree id="n9958" type="main" key="concursa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concursātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who runs hither and thither;</hi> in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a skirmisher</hi> (opp. statarius; <cit><quote lang="la">rare, perh. only in Livy): concursator et vagus pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 35, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levis et concursator hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 18, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
concursatorius: <entryFree id="n9959" type="hapax" key="concursa_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concursātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>concursator</etym>, <sense id="n9959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to skirmishing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna,</quote> <trans><tr>a skirmish</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
concursio: <entryFree id="n9960" type="main" key="concursi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concursĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>concurro, II.</etym>, <sense id="n9960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a running</hi> or <hi rend="ital">meeting together, a concurrence, concourse</hi> (several times in Cic.; elsewhere rare). </sense><sense id="n9960.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">atomorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (corpora) concursionibus inter se cohaerescant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:29" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebra vocum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:44:151" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 44, 151</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">crebrae vocalium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuitorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:20:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 20, 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9960.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., in rhet., <hi rend="ital">a figure of speech, consisting of an emphatic repetition of the last words of a sentence</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sumplokh/</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">concursio et impetus in eadem verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 206</bibl></cit> (quoted by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 33</bibl>); cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 14, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concurso: <entryFree id="n9961" type="main" key="concurso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-curso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n9961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9961.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To come violently together, to rush together, clash</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">concursare, coire et dissultare vicissim (semina),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 396</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n9961.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To go to and fro, run about, rush hither and thither, travel about</hi> (cf. commeo). </sense><sense id="n9961.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc hinc, nunc illinc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Titurius trepidare, concursare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concursabant barbatuli juvenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies noctesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:29:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 29, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 8, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circum tabernas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:24:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 24, 12</bibl></cit>: cum concursant ceteri praetores, <hi rend="ital">to travel about</hi> (corresp. with tempus in itineribus consumere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:12:section=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 12, § 29</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his administrandis rebus quam maxime concursari jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 50</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9961.4" n="2" level="3"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to skirmish</hi>: in proelio,<pb n="406" /> <cb n="CONC" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 2, 7</bibl>; cf. concursatio, III. 2., and concursator.—</sense><sense id="n9961.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: concursare aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to rove</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ramble somewhere, to visit a place, to frequent</hi> (only in Cic.; sometimes interchanged with circumcurso; <cit><quote lang="la">v. h. v.): cum jam hoc novo more omnes fere domos omnium concursent,</quote> <trans><tr>to go from house to house</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:21:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 21, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concursare et obire provinciam (praetores),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:31:section=80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 31, § 80</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the preced.: concursare omnium mortalium non modo lectos, verum etiam grabatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:63:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 63, 129</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">concursare lecticula mecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
concursus: <entryFree id="n9962" type="main" key="concursus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concursus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>concurro</etym>. <sense id="n9962.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A running</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flocking together, a concourse, assembly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fit concursus per vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">incredibilem in modum concursus fiunt ex agris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni domum concursus ad Afranium fiebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni concursus sunt facti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concursus fit celeriter in praetorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in forum a totā urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 56, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 454</bibl></cit>: undique concursus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 10, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 7, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9962.1" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">absol., an uproar, tumult</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem concursum in oppido factum putatis? quem clamorem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:23:section=52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 23, § 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 5, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quive coetu, concursu, turbā, seditione incendium fecerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 26, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:6:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 6, 5</bibl> pr.— </sense><sense id="n9962.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A running</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dashing together, a pressing, striking one upon another, an encountering, meeting; a concourse</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n9962.3" n="A" level="2"> Of corporeal objects. </sense><sense id="n9962.4" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">concursus, motus, etc. (corporum quorundam) efficiunt ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:686" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 686</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">concursu suo nubes excussere semina ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 161</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 436</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:811" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 811</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuito (atomorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:24:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 24, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 27, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae et solis,</quote> <trans><tr>conjunction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 4</bibl></cit>: oris, <hi rend="ital">a shutting</hi> (v. concurro, II. A. 1.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 56</bibl> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">asper verborum,</quote> <trans><tr>a harsh combination</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:43:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 43, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremorum verborum cum insequentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:44:150" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 44, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinque amnium in unum confluens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 75</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9962.5" n="2" level="3"> Esp., milit. t. t., <hi rend="ital">an onset, attack, charge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utriusque exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphic. 1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Iphic. 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerrimo concursu pugnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eum. 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hann. 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:30:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 30, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:59:4" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 59, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:695" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 695</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">proelii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9962.6" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9962.7" n="(a)" level="5"> Concursus omnium philosophorum sustinere, <hi rend="ital">assaults</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 22, 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9962.8" n="(b)" level="5"> Jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">an equal claim, joint heirship</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:80" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:15" default="NO">39, 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:2:1" default="NO">7, 2, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n9962.9" n="B" level="2"> Of abstr. objects, <hi rend="ital">a meeting together, union, combination</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestissimorum studiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:34:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 34, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 2</bibl></cit> (corresp. with vis tempestatum): <cit><quote lang="la">ex rationis et firmamenti conflictione et quasi concursu quaestio exoritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:30:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 30, 104</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
concurvo: <entryFree id="n9963" type="hapax" key="concurvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-curvo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n9963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to curve, bend</hi>, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 7</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 118 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
concussibilis: <entryFree id="n9964" type="hapax" key="concussi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concussĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>concutio</etym>, <sense id="n9964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be shaken</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concussio: <entryFree id="n9965" type="main" key="concussi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concussĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (post-Aug.), <sense id="n9965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shaking, concussion.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9965.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">vasorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assidua facium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 9, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasta concussio quae duas suppressit urbes,</quote> <trans><tr>an earthquake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:25:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 25, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9965.2" n="II" level="1"> In jurid. Lat., <hi rend="ital">an extortion of money by means of threats</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 13</bibl>: de concussione, several times; also <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Scap. 4 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
concussor: <entryFree id="n9966" type="main" key="concussor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concussor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who extorts money by threats</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Fuga in Persec. 12 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
concussura: <entryFree id="n9967" type="main" key="concussu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concussūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, = concussio, II., <sense id="n9967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the extorting of money by threats</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Scap. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
concussus: <entryFree id="n9968" type="main" key="concussus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concussus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from concutio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n9969" type="main" key="concussus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">concussus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>concutio</etym>, <sense id="n9969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shaking, concussion;</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 290</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:547" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 547</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 16, 55, § 193</bibl>, the better read. is concussis; v. Sillig ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
concustodio: <entryFree id="n9970" type="gloss" key="concusto_di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-custōdĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n9970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to guard, watch carefully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">NATOS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2486</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
concutio: <entryFree id="n9971" type="main" key="concu^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-cŭtĭo</orth>, <itype>cussi, cussum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>quatio, as cur = quāre</etym>. <sense id="n9971.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To strike one upon another, to strike together</hi> (rare): utrum cavae manus concutiantur, an planae, Sen. <cb n="CONC" /> Q. N. 2, 28, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">concussā manu dare signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frameas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9971.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To shake violently, to shake, agitate</hi> (freq. and class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n9971.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): concutit ungula terram, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 419 Vahl.): tonitru concussa aequora caeli, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 505, 8</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 224 Rib.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">templa caeli summa sonitu (in a parodying of pathos),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">serena caeli sonitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:358" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 358</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandi tonitru concussa repente Terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:551" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 551</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:544" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 544</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra ingenti motu concussa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 10, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:781" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 781</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concussae cadunt urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1236</bibl></cit>: concusso terrae motu theatro, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">freta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:691" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 691</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 201: undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:605" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 605</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1076" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1076</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:595" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 595</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:949" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 949</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora risu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:918" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 918</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:976" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 976</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:101" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caesariem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:179" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 179</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">comam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:846" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 846</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:644" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 644</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:465" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:755" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 755</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma manu,</quote> <trans><tr>to hurl</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:143" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 143</bibl></cit>; 7, 130; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tela lacertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te certo arcu,</quote> <trans><tr>to hit surely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:7:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inmissis aurigae undantia lora Concussere jugis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in calicibus concussis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 16, 55, § 193</bibl></cit> Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">munimenta arietibus admotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:2:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures Caesaris concutit fragor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus concutit gestatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 15:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 15, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora planctu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:179" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 179</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum (ignium) ictu concuti aera verum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 43, 43, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus concutitur gestatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majore cachinno Concutitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:100" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concutitur sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 249</bibl></cit>.—Esp. in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mugitibus aether,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risu tremulo (ora),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:919" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 919</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:976" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 976</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rates,</quote> <trans><tr>shattered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:59" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:846" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 846</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus vulnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:70" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 4, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 6, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materies per artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:949" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 949</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lyrnesia moenia dextrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13</bibl></cit> (4, 12), 53: <cit><quote lang="la">paries,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:18:section=11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 18, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remo concusso tollere ratem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:340" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 340</bibl></cit>.— With Gr. <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus concussa crebris verberibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 335</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9971.3" n="2" level="3"> Se, <hi rend="ital">to examine by shaking one's self;</hi> the figure taken from the searching of a thief, etc., by shaking his garments; hence, trop. equiv. <hi rend="ital">to search, examine</hi> (cf. excutio): <cit><quote lang="la">te ipsum Concute, num qua tibi vitiorum inseverit olim Natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 35</bibl></cit> Orell. ad loc. and cf. B. 3. infra.—</sense><sense id="n9971.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n9971.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To shake the power of, shake to its foundation, to shatter, cause to waver, to impair, disturb, distract</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:42:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 42, 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:6:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincias magnis momentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:78" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes Lacedaemoniorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincias magnis molimentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:78:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 78, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concusso jam et paene fracto Hannibale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:44:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 44, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concussā Transrhenanorum fide,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum concusso senatusconsulto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 14, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium Persarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 14, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 114</bibl> (115), 3: <cit><quote lang="la">concussa fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 182</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n9971.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To shake in feeling, to agitate violently.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9971.7" n="a" level="4"> Usually, <hi rend="ital">to put in fear, terror</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">anxiety, to terrify, alarm, trouble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrorem metum concutientem definiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules declarantur M. Tullius et C. Antonius, quod factum primo populares conjurationis concusserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum Romanum terrore Numantini belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:90:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 90, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:666" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 666</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam Asiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens barbaros pavor concusserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:2:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casu concussus acerbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 700</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 99 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extemplo turbati animi concussaque vulgi Pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 451</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> in a Greek constr.: <cit><quote lang="la">casu animum concussus amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:869" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 869</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc concussa metu mentem Juturna virago,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 468</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 295</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9971.8" n="(b)" level="5"> In the jurists: aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to terrify one by threats</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">in order to extort money from him</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:18:6:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 18, 6, § 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 25, 12</bibl>; Cod. Th. 9, 27, 6; cf. concussio, II., concussor, and concussura.—</sense><sense id="n9971.9" n="b" level="4"> In gen., of any excitement of the passions: magnum et summum est deoque vicinum, non concuti. Hanc stabilem animi sedem Graeci <foreign lang="greek">eu)qumi/an</foreign> vocant ... ego tranquillitatem voco, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc agite: Poenas petite violatae Stygis: Concutite pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 105" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9971.10" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To urge, excite, rouse to activity</hi>,<cb n="COND" />  = excitare, commovere (rare and not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">fecundum concute pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu concute plebem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Poet. 124, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se concussere ambae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:328" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non leviter se Numidia concussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">concussus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., stirred up, restless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pallas aliquanto concussior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 332</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
condalium: <entryFree id="n9972" type="main" key="conda^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condălĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (access. form more nearly related to the Greek: CONDULUS anulus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=38:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 38, 14</bibl> Müll.; cf. condylus) [<foreign lang="greek">kondu/lion, ko/ndulos</foreign>; cf. calix = <foreign lang="greek">ku/lic</foreign>, etc.], <sense id="n9972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little ring for slaves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 13</bibl>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">the title of a comedy not now extant</hi>, ascribed by Varr. (L. L. 7, § 77 Müll.) to Plaut., but denied to him by Attius (ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 9</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
condate: <entryFree id="n9973" type="main" key="Conda_te"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Condāte</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n9973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Aquitania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Condat</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 5, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
condator: <entryFree id="n9974" type="gloss" key="conda^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-dător</orth>, <sense id="n9974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">joint contributor</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">suntelesth/s</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</sense></entryFree>
condecens: <entryFree id="n9975" type="main" key="conde^cens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condĕcens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, v. condecet.</entryFree>
condecenter: <entryFree id="n9976" type="spur" key="conde^center"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condĕcenter</orth>, false read. for conducenter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:12:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 12, 5</bibl>.</entryFree>
condecerno: <entryFree id="n9977" type="main" key="conde_cerno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-dēcerno</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n9977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to decide, determine together</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 2, 12 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
condecet: <entryFree id="n9978" type="main" key="conde^cet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-dĕcet</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n9978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers., it becomes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">it is becoming, meet, seemly</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">capies quod te condecet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud Atticam disciplinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in se capessere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis meretricem pudorem quam aurum gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 16</bibl>; Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 277, 9</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 127 Rib.): cibaria me comesse condecet solum, Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> I. p. 101</bibl> P. (Com. Rel. v. 72 ib.) —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">condĕcens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., becoming, seemly, fit</hi> (late Lat.); <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
condeclino: <entryFree id="n9979" type="main" key="conde_cli_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-dēclīno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n9979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to decline in the same manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">casus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1065</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
condecoro: <entryFree id="n9980" type="main" key="conde^co^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-dĕcŏro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n9980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to ornament, decorate, adorn excessively</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carefully</hi> (rare): ova parire solet genus pinnis condecoratum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=59" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 59</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 10 Vahl.): ludos scenicos, * Ter. Hec. alt. prol. 37: loca picturis, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 37, § 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">actiones, amici. tias, domos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1, 11</bibl>; Cod. Th. 10, 22, 1 al.</sense></entryFree>
condecurialis: <entryFree id="n9981" type="hapax" key="conde^cu^ria_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-dĕcŭriālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who has been a decurion with one</hi>, Fragm. Jur. Civ. Antejust. p. 39 Mai.</sense></entryFree>
condecurio: <entryFree id="n9982" type="gloss" key="conde^cu^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-dĕcŭrĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-decurion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3733</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
condelector: <entryFree id="n9983" type="main" key="conde_lector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-dēlector</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n9983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. pass., to be delighted with something</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">lege Dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:7:22 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 7, 22 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
condeliquesco: <entryFree id="n9984" type="hapax" key="conde_li^quesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-dēlĭquesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n9984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to melt wholly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">completely, to dissolve</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">resina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 23, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
condemnabilis: <entryFree id="n9985" type="hapax" key="condemna_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condemnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>condemno</etym>, <sense id="n9985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worthy of condemnation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Insit. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
condemnatio: <entryFree id="n9986" type="main" key="condemna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condemnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a condemning, condemnation</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:10:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condemnationem facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to condemn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:59" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 42, 1, 59</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">or,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring about the condemnation of one</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pati,</quote> <trans><tr>to be condemned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:2:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: post condemnationem, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 180</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. absolutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Cic. Div. in Caecil. 7:24" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Cic. Div. in Caecil. 7, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
condemnator: <entryFree id="n9987" type="main" key="condemna_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condemnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. *<sense id="n9987.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who gives sentence, a condemner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">delicti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n9987.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who causes a condemnation, an accuser</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Claudiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 66</bibl></cit>; cf. condemno, II.</sense></entryFree>
condemno: <entryFree id="n9988" type="main" key="condemno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-demno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>damno</etym>. <sense id="n9988.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To sentence, condemn, convict</hi> (in good prose; rare in the poets). </sense><sense id="n9988.1" n="A" level="2"> In judicial proceedings (opp. absolvo); constr. <hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">gen., abl., de aliquā re</hi>, later with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in aliquid</hi>, or with <hi rend="ital">ut.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9988.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc per judicem condemnabis, cujus de eā re nullum est arbitrium?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 9, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scamandrum, Fabricium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:22:59 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 22, 59 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum judex esset, pecuniam acciperet ab accusatore ut reum condemnaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 13, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis de consilii sententiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 44</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">114: aliquem judicio turpissimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:39:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 39, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteros causā incognitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:29:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 29, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Murenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:99" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super quadraginta reos ex diversis criminibus una sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliauem multā inrogatā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 3</bibl></cit> et <pb n="407" /> <cb n="COND" /> saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc hominem Veneri absolvat, sibi condemnat,</quote> <trans><tr>for his own benefit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:8:section=22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 8, § 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: illum libertum illi patrono HS. X. milia condemnare, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to pay him</hi>, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 46</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> with kindr. <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi ei, qui magnā fide societatem gererent, arbitrium pro socio condemnari solerent,</quote> <trans><tr>in an arbitration on the partnership</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: quidquid hereditario nomine condemnatus esset, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 252</bibl>.—And in jurid. formulae, also in <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> with <case>acc.</case> of that to or in which one is condemned or mulcted: judex, si condemnat, certam pecuniam condemnare debet, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">usuras usurarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 1, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9988.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ambitūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:36:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 36, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem capitis,</quote> <trans><tr>capitally</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:54:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 54, 233</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:8:section=22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 8, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae publicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 18, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum capitalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sponsionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:31:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 31, 91</bibl></cit>: voti, <hi rend="ital">obliged to fulfil his vow</hi> (because his wish was granted), Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 277, 6</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 153 Rib.); Turp. ib. (Com. Rel. v. 128 ib.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">damnare voti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:37:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 37, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9988.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem eodem crimine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actionibus famosis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:6:section=1 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 6, § 1 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitali poenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certā pecuniā,</quote> <trans><tr>to a certain sum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:1:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">minori pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:3:20" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 27, 3, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9988.5" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">de aliquā re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de aleā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:23:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 23, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de ambitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 41</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">ad aliquid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad metalla, et munitiones viarum aut bestias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad bestias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 23, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:9:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">in aliquid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in antliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in solidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:3:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in certam quantitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:1:45" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 46, 1, 45</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">condemnatus, ut pecuniam solvat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9988.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to condemn, to accuse of, charge with; to blame, disapprove</hi>: vestra amatis; <cit><quote lang="la">ceteros causā incognitā condemnatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:29:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 29, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum judicio amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 17, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 10, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleris generum suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem inertiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:38:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 38, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem summae iniquitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 19</bibl></cit>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gabinii litteras quādam notā atque ignominiā condemnastis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 10, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9988.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To urge the condemnation of a person, to effect it, to prosecute</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ego hoc uno crimine illum condemnem necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 10, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:69:section=177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 69, § 177</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:9:25 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc.
