Com. 9, 25 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto apud judicem hunc argenti condemnabo facilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fannium Caepionem ... reum majestatis apud judices fecit et condemnavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:33" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 23, 3, 33</bibl>; cf. damno.</sense></entryFree>
condensatio: <entryFree id="n9989" type="hapax" key="condensa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condensātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>condenso</etym>, <sense id="n9989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a condensing, condensation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:18:187" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 18, 187</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
condenso: <entryFree id="n9990" type="main" key="condenso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condenso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype> (access form *<orth extent="full" lang="la">con-densĕo</orth>, ēre: <sense id="n9990.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">quia se condenseat aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 392</bibl></cit>; cf. denseo = denso), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>condensus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to make very dense, to condense, to press close together</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): oves se congregant ac condensant in locum unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: aciem, Auct. B. Afr. 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:18:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 18, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">condensari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus condensata subsidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:17:8" default="NO">4, 17, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
condensus: <entryFree id="n9991" type="main" key="condensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-densus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n9991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., very dense, close, thick</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; most freq. in Lucr.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): condensa contextaque magis (corpora),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condensa atque arta nubila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:466" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 466</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conciliatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:575" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 575</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 606</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppes litore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 497</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columbae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 516</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 73, 94, § 202</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vallis arboribus,</quote> <trans><tr>thickly covered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:39:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 39, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condensi ruunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:639" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 639</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:365" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 365</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
condepso: <entryFree id="n9992" type="main" key="condepso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-depso</orth>, <itype>depsŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n9992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to knead together</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 40, 2</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 76, 2</bibl>; Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 39, 13</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 86 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
condescendo: <entryFree id="n9993" type="main" key="conde_scendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-dēscendo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, no <sense id="n9993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, 3, <hi rend="ital">v. n., to stoop, let one's self down, to condescend</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 11, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Amic. 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad alicujus inscitiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Cant. Cantic. 6, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
condescensio: <entryFree id="n9994" type="main" key="conde_scensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-dēscensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>,<gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n9994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">condescension</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">seu demissio Jesu Christi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, c. de S. Trinit. <cb n="COND" /></sense></entryFree>
condesertor: <entryFree id="n9995" type="hapax" key="conde_sertor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-dēsertor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n9995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-deserter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carn. Chr. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
condicio: <entryFree id="n9996" type="main" key="condi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condĭcĭo</orth> (in many MSS. and edd. incorrectly <orth extent="full" lang="la">condĭtĭo</orth>, and hence falsely derived from condo; cf. 2. conditio), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>condico</etym>, <sense id="n9996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an agreement, stipulation, condition, compact, proposition, terms, demand.</hi> </sense><sense id="n9996.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n9996.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui condicionem ferre,</quote> <trans><tr>to offer terms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 51</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 91</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:45:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 45, 13 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognitis suis postulatis atque aequitate condicionum perspectā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 14, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non respuit condicionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 42</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 6, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne si pax cum Romanis fieret, ipse per condiciones ad supplicium traderetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 61 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condiciones pacis, quas adfertis, si accepero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:11:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posse condicionibus bellum poni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 112:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 112, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum de condicionibus tractat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his condicionibus conpositā pace,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquot populos aut vi subegit aut condicionibus in societatem accepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quā condicione,</quote> <trans><tr>in consequence of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 35, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub condicionibus eis pacem agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipe sub certā condicione preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:320" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 320</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub condicione,</quote> <trans><tr>conditionally</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 40, 8</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; usu. without a <pos>prep.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">eā enim condicione acceperas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 39, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eādem condicione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:44:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 44, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:71:235" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 71, 235</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:6:section=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 6, § 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 79:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 79, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">istā quidem condicione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:de Or. 2:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullā condicione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Verr. 2:1:52:section=137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 52, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ullā condicione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Fl. 18:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fl. 18, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his legibus, his condicionibus erit quisquam tam stultus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Verr. 2:3:29:section=70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 29, § 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9996.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: fert illam condicionem, ut ambo exercitus tradant, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 14, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eā accepisse condicione, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 24, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac condicione, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 13, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubere ei praemium tribui sed eā condicione, ne quid postea scriberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 10, 25</bibl></cit> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">permisit eā solā condicione, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecit pacem his condicionibus: ne qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:13 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 13 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n9996.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">si</hi> (rare; not in Cic.): librum tibi eā condicione daret, si reciperes te correcturum, Caecin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9996.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dum</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">jam vero istā condicione, dum mihi liceat negare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:22:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 22, 101</bibl></cit>.— Also transf. subject., <hi rend="ital">free choice, option</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum condicio erat,</quote> <trans><tr>who had their choice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 20</bibl></cit>.—From the conditions made in marriage, </sense><sense id="n9996.6" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a marriage, match;</hi> sometimes, by meton., = <hi rend="ital">the person married</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n9996.7" n="1" level="3"> In an honorable sense, in full: <cit><quote lang="la">condicio uxoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:10:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 10, 34</bibl></cit>; usu. alone: tu condicionem hanc accipe; <cit><quote lang="la">ausculta mihi, Atque eam desponde mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 60</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eam in se dignam condicionem conlocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc condicionem si quoi tulero extrario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliam quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:38:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 38, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condicionem filiae quaerendam esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:45:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 45, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 12, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui deferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 14, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:33" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:17" default="NO">5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 7, 8</bibl>.—Hence, in the jurists, the formula of separation: <cit><quote lang="la">condicione tuā non utor,</quote> <trans><tr>I will not have you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 2, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n9996.8" n="2" level="3"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">an amour, the relation of lover</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mistress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accepit condicionem, dein quaestum occipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tibi Condicio nova, luculenta, fertur per me,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; and hence, meton., <hi rend="ital">a lover, paramour</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habeo hortos ... hinc licet condiciones cottidie legas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 15, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:69" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 69</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Anton. Phil. 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 5, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9996.9" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the external position, situation, condition, rank, place, circumstances</hi> (very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n9996.10" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">est haec condicio liberorum populorum. etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condicio infirma et fortuna servorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:13:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 13, 41</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tolerabilis servitutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condicione eo meliore est senex quam adulescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 19, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:8:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 8, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista condicio est testium, ut quibus creditum non sit negantibus, eisdem credatur dicentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia oratoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:37" default="NO">3, 8, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus condicio vitaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 50</bibl></cit>: abjectae extremaeque sortis. Suet. Calig.<cb n="COND" />  35: fuit intactis quoque cura condicione super communi, <hi rend="ital">solicitude concerning their common condition</hi> or <hi rend="ital">circumstances</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ot. Sap. 31:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ot. Sap. 31, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 308" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 308</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 28, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n9996.11" n="B" level="2"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">a situation, condition, nature, mode, manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae consuerint gigni gignentur eādem Condicione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:21:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 21, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 101, § 158</bibl></cit>: aliquam vitae sequi, <hi rend="ital">mode</hi> or <hi rend="ital">manner of living</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 7, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">earum (frugum) cultus et condiciones tradere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:51:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 51, 116</bibl></cit> B. and K.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec vivendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversa causarum inter ipsas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duplex ejus disceptationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel temporum vel locorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
condicionabilis: <entryFree id="n9997" type="hapax" key="condi^ci^o_na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condĭcĭōnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>condicio</etym>, <sense id="n9997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conditional</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">persecutio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
condicionalis: <entryFree id="n9998" type="main" key="condi^ci^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condĭcĭōnālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">condit-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n9998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with a condition attached, conditional, with conditions</hi> (freq. in the jurists): <cit><quote lang="la">datio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:4:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creditores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:54" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 16, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 1, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">criminatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<orth extent="full" lang="la">condĭcĭōnālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., conditionally</hi> (opp. pure, simpliciter): <cit><quote lang="la">conceptā causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:1:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 25, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:98:section=5 al" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 46, 3, 98, § 5 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
condico: <entryFree id="n9999" type="main" key="condi_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-dīco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n9999.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To talk a thing over together, to agree upon, to concert, to promise</hi> (most freq. as publicists' t. t.): condixit pater patratus populi Romani Quiritium patri patrato priscorum Latinorum, etc., old form ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 11</bibl>: status condictusve dies cum hoste, Cincius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:4:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam pactum atque condictum cum rege populi Romani perfide ruperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:54" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic constituunt, sic condicunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inducias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:7:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus et locum coëundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:2:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruptā quiete condictā,</quote> <trans><tr>the truce</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in diem tertium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:24:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 24, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vendendo fundo quaedam etiam si non condicantur praestanda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:66" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 66</bibl></cit>.—*</sense><sense id="n9999.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: cum hanc operam (scribendi) condicerem, <hi rend="ital">obligated myself to it</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">undertook it</hi>, Plin. praef. § 6 Jan.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n9999.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n9999.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To proclaim, announce, publish</hi>: condicere est dicendo denuntiare, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=64:16" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 64, 16</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotes populi Romani cum condicunt in diem tertium, diem perendini dicunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:24:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 24, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9999.4" n="2" level="3"> Condicere alicui ad cenam or cenam, <hi rend="ital">to engage one's self as guest at an entertainment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad cenam aliquo condicam foras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">seni cenam eā lege condixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">velut ad subitam condictamque cenulam invitare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>without previous preparation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam cum mihi condixisset, cenavit apud me in mei generi hortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad balneas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Uxor. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n9999.5" n="3" level="3"> In the jurists: condicere aliquid alicui, lit., <hi rend="ital">to give notice that something should be returned;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">to demand back, make a formal claim of restitution</hi> (from any one): <cit><quote lang="la">rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:6:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:1:11" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; or for satisfaction: quia extinctae res, licet vindicari non possunt, condici tamen furibus et quibusdam aliis possessoribus possunt, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 79</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5</bibl>, and v. condictio and condicticius.—</sense><sense id="n9999.6" n="II" level="1"> In late Lat., <hi rend="ital">to assent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">agree unanimously</hi>, = consentire, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Coron. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
condicticius: <entryFree id="n10000" type="main" key="condicti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condictīcĭus-</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>condictio</etym>, <sense id="n10000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a demand of restitution</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:1:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 1, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:2:13:section=2 al" default="NO">12, 2, 13, § 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
condictio: <entryFree id="n10001" type="main" key="condicti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>condico</etym>. <sense id="n10001.0" n="I" level="1"> In the lang. of religion, <hi rend="ital">the proclamation of a festival</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 3, 117</bibl> (without voucher); cf.: condictio, in diem certum ejus rei quae agitur denuntiatio, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=66" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 66</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n10001.1" n="II" level="1"> In jurid. Lat., <hi rend="ital">a formal claim of restitution</hi>, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 4, 18 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:6:30 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 6, 30 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
condigne: <entryFree id="n10002" type="main" key="condigne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condignē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. condignus <sense id="n10002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
condignus: <entryFree id="n10003" type="main" key="condignus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-dignus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n10003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., wholly deserving, very worthy</hi> (very rare; mostly anteand post-class.). </sense><sense id="n10003.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">condignum donum, quali'st qui donum dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:39 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 39 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10003.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum condignam te sectaris simiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10003.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: ultio condigna crimini, Cod. Th. 9, 28, 1; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 35, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10003.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">providentiae divinae condignus exitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 244, 21</bibl></cit>. <pb n="408" /> <cb n="COND" /> —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">condignē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">very worthily.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10003.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">condigne facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 4, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">condigne atque recte loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:6:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condigne et cum decore depingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:4:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10003.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">condigne te cubare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 39</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> are not in use.</sense></entryFree>
condimentarius: <entryFree id="n10004" type="main" key="condi_menta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condīmentārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>condimentum</etym>, <sense id="n10004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to spices</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seasoning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caepae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 32, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 8, 50, § 165</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10004.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">condī-mentārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who prepares</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sells spices;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium haereticorum (Platonem),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
condimentum: <entryFree id="n10005" type="main" key="condi_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>condio</etym> (rare; <sense id="n10005.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in Plaut. and Cic.),</quote> <trans><tr>spice, seasoning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 3 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:31 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 31 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 28, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:51:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 51, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridia,</quote> <trans><tr>green herbs used in seasoning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:8:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10005.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">condimentum postremum Fabulae plausus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optumum aerumnae est animus aequus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 71</bibl></cit> (but the verse <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 87</bibl>, is prob. spurious; cf. Ritschl <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiae suavitas quaedam sermonum atque morum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 18, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium sermonum facetiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:67:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 67, 271</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:7:section=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 7, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condimenti fortasse non nihil, utilitatis certe nihil (voluptas) habebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 33, 120</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
condio: <entryFree id="n10006" type="main" key="condi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>an access. form from condo, q. v. II., and cf. compono, II. B. 2.</etym> (orig. belonging to econ. lang.). <sense id="n10006.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To put fruit</hi> in vinegar, wine, spices, etc., <hi rend="ital">to preserve, pickle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleas albas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lactucam (corresp. with componere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:9:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:7:5" default="NO">12, 7, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corna, pruna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:10:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caules vitium in aceto et muriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:119 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 19, 23, § 119 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10006.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10006.2" n="a" level="4"> Unguenta, <hi rend="ital">to make fragrant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 99</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10006.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To embalm</hi> a dead body: <cit><quote lang="la">mortuos (Aegyptii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:45:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 45, 108</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10006.4" n="II" level="1"> Of food, <hi rend="ital">to make savory, to season, spice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meas escas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fungos, helvellas, herbas omnes ita, ut nihil possit esse suavius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus male conditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:6:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 6, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quis non videt, desideriis omnia ista condiri?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 97</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10006.5" n="2" level="3"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-dītum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. vinum), <hi rend="ital">aromatic wine, spiced wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 19, § 103</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Febr. 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:5 al" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 5 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n10006.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cultivate, ornament; to make pleasant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">agreeable; to soften, temper</hi>, etc. (freq. in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">duo sunt, quae condiant orationem: verborum numerorumque jucunditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:55:185" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 55, 185</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 38</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and 6, 3, 40: vitia,</quote> <trans><tr>to set off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 26, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hilaritate tristitiam temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 40, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravitatem comitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 4, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 31, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid natura asperum pluribus voluptatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbanitatem ambiguitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 96</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">condītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n10006.7" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to II. A.) <hi rend="ital">Seasoned, savory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conditiora facit haec supervacanei etiam operis aucupium atque venatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10006.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (acc. to II. B.), of discourse, <hi rend="ital">polished, ornamented</hi>: sermo, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:52:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 52, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium condita oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:182" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 182</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio lepore et festivitate conditior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:56:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 56, 227</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:29:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 29, 110</bibl>. —Of the speaker: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo suavitate conditior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:48:177" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 48, 177</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> not in use.</sense></entryFree>
condiscipula: <entryFree id="n10007" type="main" key="condisci^pu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condiscĭpŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>condiscipulus</etym>, <sense id="n10007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female school-fellow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:35:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 35, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 224 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
condiscipulatus: <entryFree id="n10008" type="main" key="condisci^pu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condiscĭpŭlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">companionship in school</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 5, 3</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:6:17" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 6, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 7392</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
condiscipulus: <entryFree id="n10009" type="main" key="condisci^pu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-discĭpŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>,<gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n10009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a school-mate, companion at school</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:18:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 18, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 19, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:12" default="NO">2, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
condisco: <entryFree id="n10010" type="main" key="condisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-disco</orth>, <itype>dĭdĭci, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> * <sense id="n10010.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To learn with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in company with one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex his, qui mihi Athenis condidicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 3</bibl></cit>, n. 18, p. 362, 8.—</sense><sense id="n10010.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To learn carefully, eagerly</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">well, to learn thoroughly</hi> (rare but class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10010.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">modos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 11, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen a teneris annis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 25</bibl></cit>: genera plausuum, *Suet. <cb n="COND" /> Ner. 20: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:462" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 462</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n10010.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego istuc aliis dare condidici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merum bibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi paulo diligentius supplicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:9:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foris pasci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauperiem pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—*</sense><sense id="n10010.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">relative-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">condiscere qui pecuniae fructus esset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 3, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10010.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (flagellum) paulatim condiscat suis radicibus ali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:15:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 15, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 10, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 5, 11, § 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conditaneus: <entryFree id="n10011" type="main" key="condi_ta_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condītānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>condio</etym>, of fruits, etc., <sense id="n10011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suitable for pickling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">preserving, pickled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">olea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:24:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 24, 1</bibl></cit> (quoted in <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 94, 9 sq.</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">ostreae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:9:6" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
conditicius: <entryFree id="n10012" type="hapax" key="condi^ti^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condĭtĭcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>condo</etym>, <sense id="n10012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">laid up, preserved</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 8, 2</bibl></cit> (Schneid. conditiva).</sense></entryFree>
conditio: <entryFree id="n10013" type="main" key="condi^ti^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condĭtĭo</orth> (condition, etc.), v. condicio, etc.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10014" type="main" key="condi^ti^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>condo</etym>, <sense id="n10014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making, creating;</hi> and, meton., <hi rend="ital">a thing made, a work</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Habit. Mul. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Spect. 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10015" type="main" key="condi_ti^o3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>condio</etym>. <sense id="n10015.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A preserving of fruits</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">amurcae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:61" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 61</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:61" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 61</bibl> (for <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:51:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 51, 116</bibl>, v. condicio, II. B.).—</sense><sense id="n10015.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A spicing, seasoning, flavoring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">suci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=109" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:53:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 53, 1</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">ciborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:58:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 58, 146</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conditionabilis: <entryFree id="n10016" type="main" key="condi^ti^o_na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condĭtĭōnābĭlis</orth>, v. condicionabilis.</entryFree>
conditionalis: <entryFree id="n10017" type="main" key="condi^ti^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condĭtĭōnālis</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ālĭter</orth>, v. con dicionalis.</entryFree>
conditivus: <entryFree id="n10018" type="main" key="condi^ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condĭtīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>condo</etym>, <sense id="n10018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suitable for laying up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">preserving, laid up, preserved</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): olea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:59:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 59, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. also conditicius.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">condĭtīvum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a tomb</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 60:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 60, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:82:2" default="NO">82, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4511</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conditor: <entryFree id="n10019" type="main" key="condi^tor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker, builder, framer, establisher, founder, author, compiler</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n10019.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (class.; most freq. in the poets and prose writers after the Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n10019.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanae arcis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum magnum, cujus conditor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 89:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 89, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra infantium conditorum urbis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Romulus and Remus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:23:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 23, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">casa illa conditoris nostri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:53:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 53, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of the founders of states,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 566</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 849</bibl>; *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:394" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 394</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 16, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:2:4 al" default="NO">3, 2, 4 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">98</bibl> Bremi al.: <cit><quote lang="la">tanti regni Cyrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>: historiae, Ov. lb. 522; Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani anni,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>author of the Fasti</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:21" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientiae medicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pessimorum carminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:5:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum atque jurium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 86</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">legum lator conditorque Romani juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 58, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus sacri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanae libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 34, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:42:4" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 42, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 119:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 119, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 655" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phoen. 655</bibl>.—Rarely, </sense><sense id="n10019.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: T. Sicinium ... conditorem Veios sequantur, i. e. <hi rend="ital">who advises a removal to Veii</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">ktisth/n</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:24:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 24, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conditorum, parentum, deorum numero nobis eritis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 30, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificium quod Aeneae conditori faciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humilis,</quote> <trans><tr>writer, author</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:4" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—In a sarcastic pun: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse conditor totius negotii Guttam aspergit huic Balbo (with allusion to the meaning of condo, to lay up fruits, cf. the foll.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 26, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10019.4" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Condĭ-tor</orth>, <hi rend="ital">nom. propr., a rural deity who presided over the laying up of fruits</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10020" type="main" key="condi_tor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>condio</etym>, <sense id="n10020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who prepares a thing in a savory manner, a seasoner</hi> (very rare): ciconiarum, Poët. ap. Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conditorium: <entryFree id="n10021" type="main" key="condi^to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condĭtōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>condo</etym>, <sense id="n10021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place where any thing is laid up, a repository</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n10021.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">tormentorum muralium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10021.2" n="II" level="1"> Specif. </sense><sense id="n10021.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A place for preserving a dead body</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the ashes of the dead, a coffin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 7, § 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10021.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A tomb, sepulchre</hi>, in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 111, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">112, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2473</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conditrix: <entryFree id="n10022" type="main" key="condi_^trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condī^trix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. conditor</etym>. <sense id="n10022.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">She who lays to rest</hi> (late Lat.): luna mortalium corporum et auctor et conditrix, Macr. <cb n="COND" /> Somn. Scip. 1, 11.—</sense><sense id="n10022.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A female builder, founder</hi>, etc. (post-class.): Romae, Poët. ap. Philarg. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Karthaginis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apol. 50</bibl></cit>: Athenarum, Eum. Pan. pro Instaur. Schol. 9, 4.—</sense><sense id="n10022.2" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">paupertas omnium civitatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 18, p. 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestantissima potentia caeli ac terrae conditrix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conditura: <entryFree id="n10023" type="main" key="condi^tu_ra1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condĭtūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>condo</etym>, <sense id="n10023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a preparing, making</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitreorum (vasorum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 51, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 16, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10024" type="main" key="condi_tu_ra2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condītūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>condio</etym>. <sense id="n10024.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A preserving of fruits</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:48:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 48, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:49:3" default="NO">12, 49, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">olivarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:11:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 11, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10024.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A seasoning</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:15:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:19:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 19, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10024.2" n="(b)" level="5"> In concr., <hi rend="ital">a condiment, spice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:6:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 6, 9</bibl> pr.</sense></entryFree>
conditus: <entryFree id="n10025" type="main" key="condi^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from condo.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n10026" type="main" key="condi_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from condio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10027" type="main" key="condi^tus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>condo</etym>, <sense id="n10027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a preparing, founding, establishment</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Thebarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 24, p. 289</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10027.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A concealing, hiding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia altiore conditu texit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 15, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10028" type="hapax" key="condi_tus4" n="4"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>condio</etym>, <sense id="n10028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a preserving of fruits</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:22:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 22, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
condo: <entryFree id="n10029" type="main" key="condo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-do</orth>, <itype>dĭdi, dĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>con- = cum, and 2. do</etym>, lit., <sense id="n10029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring, lay</hi> or <hi rend="ital">put together</hi> (very freq. in all periods and species of composition). </sense><sense id="n10029.1" n="I" level="1"> With the access. idea of uniting, <hi rend="ital">to put</hi> or <hi rend="ital">join together into a whole, to form, fashion, produce, make by joining together.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10029.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop., of the founding of towns or states, <hi rend="ital">to found, establish</hi>: Romam, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 1, 2</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (Ann. v. 494 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">oppida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=142" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 142</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:1" default="NO">2, 15, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 92</bibl></cit>: colonias. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:15" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:3:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium Poenorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 19, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, often ante and post Romam conditam, <hi rend="ital">before</hi> and <hi rend="ital">after the foundation of Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 1, 3</bibl>; cf. Liv. praef. § 6 al.—</sense><sense id="n10029.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to the inhabitants: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanam gentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:6:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">optato conduntur Thybridis alveo,</quote> <trans><tr>they settle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 303</bibl></cit> (condi proprie dicuntur, qui sibi statuunt civitatem. Conduntur ergo; sedem stabilem locant, Serv.). —</sense><sense id="n10029.4" n="b" level="4"> Of the erecting, building of other things, <hi rend="ital">to make, construct, build</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:46:16" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 46, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:26" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 276</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 775</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:12:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 12, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10029.5" n="c" level="4"> Of written productions, <hi rend="ital">to compose, write, celebrate, write</hi> or <hi rend="ital">treat of, describe</hi>: SIVE CARMEN CONDIDISSET, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:10:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 10, 12</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 82</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 436</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:37:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 37, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 12, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 56</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">poëma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longas Iliadas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesaris acta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:336" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 336</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">festa numeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:24" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum satirae genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:95" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliqua in hac materiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prosam orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">historiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 4, 8, § 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid annalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 9, 6, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta medendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 2, 6, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudes alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 13, 15, § 35</bibl></cit>.— Rarely, </sense><sense id="n10029.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si etiamnum Homero condente Aegyptus non erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 13, 27, § 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10029.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to establish, found, to be the author of, to produce, make</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jusjurandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurea saecula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:793" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 793</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collegium novum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 52, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova fata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeternam famam ingenio suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3, prol. 53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, prol. 53</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nomen memorandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:37" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militarem disciplinam artemque bellandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:3:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somniorum intellegentiam (Joseph),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:2:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—Of the gods: <cit><quote lang="la">portenta sua,</quote> <trans><tr>to fuifil, accomplish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:126" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 126</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturā rerum conditum est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:5:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 5, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10029.8" n="II" level="1"> With the access. idea of carefulness, <hi rend="ital">to put away, to lay, put</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">place somewhere for preservation</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to lay up, store</hi> or <hi rend="ital">treasure up</hi> (opp. promo). </sense><sense id="n10029.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10029.10" n="1" level="3"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n10029.11" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 26, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 157</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 140</bibl>: condere et reponere fructus,<pb n="409" /> <cb n="COND" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:62:156" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 62, 156</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri multa efferunt, quae ... mandentur condita vetustati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 60, 151</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 4, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:62" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 62</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Afr. 65: vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:111:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 111, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid proprio horreo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabinum testā levi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pressa mella puris amphoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">messem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:42" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10029.12" n="(b)" level="5"> With the designation of the place (most freq. by <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case>): <cit><quote lang="la">minas viginti in crumenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mustum in dolium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:65:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 65, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cineres in urnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbam in auream pyxidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem in aerarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri in sacrarium conditi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:19:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 19, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the foll.: te in pistrinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 120</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in custodiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 23, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in carcerem,</quote> <trans><tr>to thrust into prison, imprison</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:29:section=76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 29, § 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 16, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 22, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 21, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">45, 42, 5: aliquem in vincula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:38:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 38, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 34, 4</bibl>. —With <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum intro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 120</bibl></cit>;
