<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 5, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortes eo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 41, 86</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras publicas in aerario sanctiore,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep, lay up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:63:section=140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 63, § 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se (aves) in foliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 473</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novissimo die dein (argyritin) condunt in plumbeo vase,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 35, § 109</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">condidit (libros Sibyllinos) duobus forulis auratis sub Palatini Apollinis basi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 145" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 145</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">locat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id domi nostrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ei jam exploratus et domi conditus consulatus videretur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>he was sure of it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:24:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 24, 49</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10029.13" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: teneo omnia; <cit><quote lang="la">in pectore condita sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandata corde memori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu, qui omne bonum in visceribus medullisque condideris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in causis conditae sunt res futurae,</quote> <trans><tr>lie, are contained</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:56:128" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 56, 128</bibl></cit>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n10029.14" n="B" level="2"> Esp., </sense><sense id="n10029.15" n="1" level="3"> In econom. lang., <hi rend="ital">to preserve, pickle</hi> (for which the access. form condio, īre, became prevalent): <cit><quote lang="la">lentiscum in acetum (cf. just before, oleae quomodo condiantur),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus in orcas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:15:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructum in cados,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corna in liquidā faece,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:666" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 666</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10029.16" n="2" level="3"> In medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">to set</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">articulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10029.17" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To inter, bury</hi> (cf. compono, II. B. 1. c.): <cit><quote lang="la">mortuos cerā circumlitos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:45:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 45, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem sepulcro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 618</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 235</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa parentis terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 48</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem terrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 54, 55, § 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora defunctorum in lapide sarcophago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 17, 27, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraternas umbras tumulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:451" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 451</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 442</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:198" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 198</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa peregrinā ripā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Tomitanā condar humo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inhumatos Manes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexandrum intemperantiā bibendi ... condidit,</quote> <trans><tr>brought to the grave</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgura publica condere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:587" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 587</bibl></cit>, v. fulgur; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Aruns dispersos fulminis ignes Colligit et terrae maesto cum murmure condit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:606 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 606 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10029.18" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of time, <hi rend="ital">to pass, spend, live through, bring to a close</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saecla vivendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1090" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1090</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longos soles cantando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum referetque diem condetque relatum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>morning and evening</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 458</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem collibus in suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:54" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 36, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 80 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:482" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 482</bibl></cit>.—In respect to lustrum, v. 2. lustrum, I.—</sense><sense id="n10029.19" n="4" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to conceal, hide, secrete, suppress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sibyllam quidem sepositam et conditam habeamus, ut ... injussu senatūs ne legantur quidem libri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:54:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 54, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid sub terrā est in apricum proferet aetas, Defodiet condetque nitentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 434</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lunam (nubes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid jocoso furto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 330</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vultum aequore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:255" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">enses,</quote> <trans><tr>to sheathe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:7:2" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">15: scuta latentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <trans><tr>to close, shut</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:44" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 44</bibl></cit> (but oculi conditi, v. <pos>P. a.</pos> infra); so, <cit><quote lang="la">lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 64: <cit><quote lang="la">se in viscera (terrae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se sub lectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 51</bibl></cit>.—Mid., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 57, 82, § 223</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocte ... aliquot Numidarum turmas medio in saltu condiderat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>placed in ambush</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 26, 8</bibl></cit>; so, hostis <cb n="COND" /> in silvis armatum militem condidit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi Dahas condidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 7, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Danai) notā conduntur in alvo,</quote> <trans><tr>concealed themselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 401</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fera murmura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 61: <cit><quote lang="la">iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 28</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">his mensibus pisces jacent speluncis conditi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 16, 24, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic sollertiā est inanium ostrearum testis se condere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 31, 51, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna condita tenebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid alvo,</quote> <trans><tr>to swallow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:199" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 199</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10029.20" n="5" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10029.21" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To thrust</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strike in deep, to plunge</hi> (cf. abscondo): <cit><quote lang="la">ensem in pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitos in lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:561" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 561</bibl></cit>; 12, 295; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 423: ensem totum alicui in adverso pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 348</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum jugulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 459</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 1037" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 1037</bibl>; cf. <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil tam facile in corpus quam sagitta conditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 5</bibl></cit>, n. 2.—</sense><sense id="n10029.22" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">stimulos caecos in pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 727</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10029.23" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To hide</hi> by sailing away, <hi rend="ital">to lose sight of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">navita condit urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:443" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 443</bibl></cit>; cf. abscondo.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10029.24" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">condĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., close, secret, deep</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">praecordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <trans><tr>deep set</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 53, § 141</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10029.25" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">condĭta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the laid up store</hi> (late Lat.), Cod. Th. 7, 4, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:95 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 95 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
condocefacio: <entryFree id="n10030" type="main" key="condo^ce^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condŏcĕ-făcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>condoceo</etym>, <sense id="n10030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to train, teach, instruct, discipline</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">beluas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:64:161" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 64, 161</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">elephantos, Auct. B. Afr. 27: tirones gladiatores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:31:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 31, 87</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
condoceo: <entryFree id="n10031" type="main" key="condo^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-dŏcĕo</orth>, <itype>cŭi, ctum, 2</itype>, <sense id="n10031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to exercise, train, instruct</hi> (very rare; perh. only in the foll. exs.): (milites) equo uti frenato, Auct. B. Afr. 19 dub. (al. condocefecerat or constituerat): <hi rend="ital">Mi.</hi> Fac modo, ut condocta tibi sint dicta ad hanc fallaciam. <hi rend="ital">Co.</hi> Quin edepol condoctior sum, quam tragoedi et comici, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 3 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
condoctor: <entryFree id="n10032" type="main" key="condoctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-doctor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n10032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-teacher</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 1:9" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
condoctus: <entryFree id="n10033" type="main" key="condoctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condoctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. condoceo.</entryFree>
condoleo: <entryFree id="n10034" type="main" key="condo^le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-dŏlĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n10034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to feel severe pain, to suffer greatly</hi> (eccl. Lat.). </sense><sense id="n10034.1" n="I" level="1"> Universum corpus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poen. 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10034.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 112</bibl></cit>, n. 12.—</sense><sense id="n10034.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To suffer with</hi> another, <hi rend="ital">to feel another's pain;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: qui non condolent proximis suis, sed potius eos irrident, Aug. in Job, 19, 13; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 37, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> Heb. 5, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
condolesco: <entryFree id="n10035" type="main" key="condo^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-dŏlesco</orth>, <itype>lŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [doleo], <hi rend="ital">to feel severe pain, to suffer much, to be in pain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">distress, to ache</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10035.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (rare, but class. in prose and poetry; most freq. in <hi rend="ital">temp. perf.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">mihi de vento miserae condoluit caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; so in <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus ei dicenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pes, dens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:22:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 22, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines, quorum alter ne condoluisse quidem umquam videtur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 41</bibl></cit>: tentatum frigore corpus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">admonitu matris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:3:32" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturā (hominem) condolescere dicerent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 10, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad suspitionem tactūs condolescunt (ulcera),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:9:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10035.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To suffer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sympathize with</hi>: anima corpori laeso ... condolescit <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
condomo: <entryFree id="n10036" type="hapax" key="condo^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-dŏmo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n10036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to tame completely, to curb, check;</hi> trop., <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
condonatio: <entryFree id="n10037" type="hapax" key="condo_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condōnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>condono</etym>, <sense id="n10037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a giving away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum possessionumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
condono: <entryFree id="n10038" type="main" key="condo_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-dōno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n10038.0" n="I" level="1"> Aliquid (aliquem) alicui, <hi rend="ital">to give something to one, to present, deliver up</hi> (in good prose; most freq. in Cic.; not in Quint.). </sense><sense id="n10038.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10038.2" n="1" level="3"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">pallam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pateram tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apothecas hominibus nequissimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia certis hominibus (corresp. with dare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facultas agrorum suis latronibus condonandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 3, 6</bibl></cit> Wernsd. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (cf. Zumpt, Gram. § <cit><quote lang="la">661): hereditatem alicui (praetor),</quote> <trans><tr>to adjudge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:41:section=105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 41, § 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10038.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to give up, surrender, deliver up, sacrifice, devote, bring as an offering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid dicioni, judicio potestatique alicujus permittere et condonare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid potentiae alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuli totam Achaiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:23:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 23, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem cruci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes inimicitias rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:18:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 18, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne patiamini M. Caelium libidini muliebri condonatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 32, 78</bibl></cit>: ut M. Aemilius cum suā <cb n="COND" /> dignitate omni ... vanissimae genti condonetur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:22:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Scaur. 22, 45</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">seque vitamque suam reipublicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 79:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 79, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum dolorem ejus voluntati ac precibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10038.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to give a debt to one</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to remit, acquit from</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10038.5" n="1" level="3"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunias creditas debitoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:22:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 22, 78</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n10038.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10038.7" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To pardon, remit an offence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut crimen hoc nobis condonetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti Jugurthae scelus condonaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 27, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10038.8" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To pardon, refrain from punishing</hi> a crime out of regard or favor: meam animadversionem et supplicium, quo usurus eram in eum, remitto tibi et condono, Vatin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterius lubidini malefacta condonare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres fratres non solum sibi ipsis, neque his tot ac talibus viris, neque nobis necessariis suis, sed etiam rei publicae condonaveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:12:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 12, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sibi ac defensioni suae condonatum esse Oppianicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:39:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 39, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">datus est tibi ille, condonatus est ille,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:31:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 31, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:73:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 73, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">filium sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum tot Claudiis deprecantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 58, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Divitiaco fratri (sc. Dumnorigem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10038.9" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquem aliquid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absol., to present one with something</hi> (only in the foll. exs.): <cit><quote lang="la">si quam (rem) debes, te condono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 24</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum, quod habes, condonamus te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 54</bibl></cit>: aurum aliquem, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 497, 29</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>, with <case>acc.</case> of thing: <cit><quote lang="la">habeo alia multa quae nunc condonabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
condormio: <entryFree id="n10039" type="main" key="condormi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-dormĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n10039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to fall quite asleep</hi> (very rare), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:78" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:10:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 10, 14</bibl> (acc. to Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 4, 11</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 125" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 125</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ver. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
condormisco: <entryFree id="n10040" type="main" key="condormisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-dormisco</orth>, <itype>dormīvi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch.</hi> [dormio], <hi rend="ital">to go entirely to sleep, to fall asleep;</hi> only in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 13</bibl>; in <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 2, 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
condrilla: <entryFree id="n10041" type="main" key="condrilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condrilla</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">condrylla</orth>, <itype>another orthography for chondrille</itype>, q. v.</entryFree>
condrusi: <entryFree id="n10042" type="main" key="Condru_si"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Condrūsi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kondrou=soi</foreign>, <sense id="n10042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in</hi> Gallia Belgica, <hi rend="ital">on the right bank of the Meuse, in the region of Lüttich and Namur</hi>, near the modern <hi rend="ital">Condroz</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conducenter: <entryFree id="n10043" type="main" key="condu_center"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condūcenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. conduco <sense id="n10043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
conducibilis: <entryFree id="n10044" type="main" key="condu_ci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condūcĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>conduco, II.</etym>, <sense id="n10044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advantageous, profitable, expedient</hi> (several times in Plaut., elsewhere rare): <cit><quote lang="la">(consilium) ad eam rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reperiamus aliquid calidi conducibilis consili,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istuc facinus mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conducibile et utile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 14</bibl>.— *<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 14, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conduco: <entryFree id="n10045" type="main" key="condu_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-dūco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n10045.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to draw, bring</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">lead together, to assemble, collect</hi> (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10045.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10045.2" n="1" level="3"> Of persons (esp. freq. of the collecting, assembling of troops in any place): milites de castellis ad castra, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 514, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum in forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. p. 274:20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. p. 274, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum in unum locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo copias omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 31 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">auxilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 21, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 13, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispersas suorum copias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgines unum in locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis clientes suos eodem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites in unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 51:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 51, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10045.3" n="2" level="3"> Of inanimate objects: <cit><quote lang="la">vineas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:572 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 572 al.</bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n10045.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., </sense><sense id="n10045.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Intens., to connect, unite</hi>, by bringing together, = cogo, colligo. </sense><sense id="n10045.6" n="a" level="4"> Prop. (so several times in Lucr., elsewhere rare): <cit><quote lang="la">partes in unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 398</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:533" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 533</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 651</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:968" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 968</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cortice ramos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 375</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac,</quote> <trans><tr>to coagulate, curdle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conducere musculum aut laxare,</quote> <trans><tr>to contract</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1</bibl></cit>, n. 8: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi sunt nervi, interiores conducunt membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 88, § 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera cerā,</quote> <trans><tr>to close up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:479 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 479 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10045.7" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">propositionem et assumptionem in unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:40:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 40, 73</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia probra in deorum maledicta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, p. 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies adeo conductus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>short</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 22</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10045.8" n="2" level="3"> T. t. of the lang. of business, <hi rend="ital">to hire, take on lease, to farm</hi> (correlative of locare; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 1</bibl>; very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n10045.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To hire for one's use, to hire, rent, employ;</hi> of things: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes aliquas mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 35</bibl>; cf.: domum in Palatio,<pb n="410" /> <cb n="COND" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 7, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui colonus habuit conductum de Caesenniā fundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:32:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 32, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitationem in annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad certum tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:14" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:30" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conduxi domum a te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:5:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummos,</quote> <trans><tr>to borrow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:46" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 46</bibl></cit>.—Esp., of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">ille qui me conduxit, ubi conduxit, abduxit domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cocum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit> and 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidicinam, quae cantaret sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretricem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 131</bibl>; Nep. praef. § 4; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">torum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:10:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 10, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulem vestrum ad caedem faciendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceptores publice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">choragum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 1</bibl></cit>; so, militem (the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">cenologei=n</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">to hire soldiers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:9:2 al" default="NO">3, 9, 2 al.</bibl>; cf. the foll. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>: aliquem uti taceat, <hi rend="ital">to hire, bribe, employ</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 10</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus non conduci possim libertatibus, quin, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>could not be hired</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 68</bibl></cit>; cf. Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 274, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercede aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:6:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercede diurnā conductus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictorem magno pretio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10045.10" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">conducti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">hirelings, mercenary soldiers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 431</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 8, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:13:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 13, 8 al.</bibl>—Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella conducta,</quote> <trans><tr>carried on by mercenary troops</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:196" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 196</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10045.11" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">conductum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">any thing hired</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">a house, dwelling</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:62:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 62, 175</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:5:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:3:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 3, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">locati conducti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19, 2</bibl></cit> tit.: actio ex conducto, <hi rend="ital">an action upon a lease</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contract</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:19" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19, 2, 19</bibl>, §§ 4 and 8 al.—</sense><sense id="n10045.12" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To undertake any service</hi> (building, transportation, the customs, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to contract for, farm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedundum illum (agnum) ego conduxi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caedundos agnos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redemptor, qui columnam illam de Cottā conduxerat faciendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:21:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 21, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locare faciendum quod ego conduxeram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:48" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 48</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">mulierem vehendam nave,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:19" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem docendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:13:section=3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19, 2, 13, § 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:6:19" default="NO">13, 6, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebenda, quae ad exercitum opus essent,</quote> <trans><tr>to undertake the supplies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:48:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 48, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalia,</quote> <trans><tr>to farm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 17, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 16, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulas in Italiam portandas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:13:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">portorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:30:47 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 30, 47 al.</bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n10045.13" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to contribute to something by being useful, to be of use</hi> or <hi rend="ital">profitable, to profit, serve</hi>, etc. (syn.: convenit, utile est; class.; used only in the 3<hi rend="ital">d pers.</hi> of the <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>); constr. with <hi rend="ital">in, ad aliquid</hi>, the <case>dat.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10045.14" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tuam in rem bene conducat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 3, 4</bibl></cit>; so, maxime in rempublicam, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 274, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in commune,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10045.15" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ventris victum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad vitae commoditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10045.16" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">huic aetati non conducit latebrosus locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:27:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 27, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque homini infanti injuste facta conducunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 32, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuae laudi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostris rationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvo citae (vinum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 23, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proposito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 195</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">imbres non conducunt vitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10045.17" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dubitare non possumus. quin ea maxime conducant, quae sunt rectissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conducere arbitror talibus auris tuas vocibus undique circumsonare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a. as subst.;</hi> v. I. C. 2. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> supra.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">condūcenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">becomingly, fitly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 12, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conducticius: <entryFree id="n10046" type="main" key="conducti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conductīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>conduco</etym>, <sense id="n10046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to hire, hired, rented</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">fidicina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> arg. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphicr. 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iphicr. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">catervae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Chabr. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: domus, Porcius, poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:Ter. 1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. Ter. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">operae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:17:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conductio: <entryFree id="n10047" type="main" key="conducti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conductĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n10047.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bringing together, uniting</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10047.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:40:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 40, 74</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 73.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n10047.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in later medic. writers, <hi rend="ital">a spasm, convulsion</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">spasmo/s</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">musculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:10" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 3:18:177" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 18, 177</bibl></cit>; 2, 3, 16 al.—</sense><sense id="n10047.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A hiring, farming</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">(fundi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:32:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 32, 94</bibl></cit>: <cb n="CONE" /> (vectigalium), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 16, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota renuntiata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 6, 16</bibl></cit> Zumpt (B. and K. condicio).</sense></entryFree>
conductitius: <entryFree id="n10048" type="main" key="conducti_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conductītĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. conducticius.</entryFree>
conductor: <entryFree id="n10049" type="main" key="conductor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conductor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>conduco</etym>, <sense id="n10049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who hires a thing, a lessee, farmer, tenant, a contractor</hi> (rare, and mostly <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">(histrionum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:prol. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. prol. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(pecoris),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 150, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(agri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 12</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 30, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aedificii),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrae arae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 12</bibl></cit>, ext. 1: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:7:40:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 7, 40, § 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4324</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:145" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 145</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conductrix: <entryFree id="n10050" type="main" key="conductrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conductrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conductor</etym>, <sense id="n10050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who hires</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rents a thing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 65, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 12, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conductus: <entryFree id="n10051" type="main" key="conductus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conductus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-ductum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. conduco, I. B. 2. a. <sense id="n10051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10052" type="hapax" key="conductus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conductus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>conduco</etym>, <sense id="n10052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a contraction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:15:95" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 15, 95</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
condulco: <entryFree id="n10053" type="hapax" key="condulco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-dulco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n10053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to sweeten</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 27, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">40, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
condulus: <entryFree id="n10054" type="gloss" key="condu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. condylus.</entryFree>
conduplicatio: <entryFree id="n10055" type="main" key="condu_^pli^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condū^plĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conduplico</etym>, <sense id="n10055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a doubling</hi> (very rare); humorously, for <hi rend="ital">embracing</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 18</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 16</bibl>).—As a figure of speech, <hi rend="ital">a repetition of the same word</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)panadi/plwsis</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 28, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conduplico: <entryFree id="n10056" type="main" key="condu_^pli^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-dū^plĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to double</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cibum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primordia rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 712</bibl></cit>: quod boni promeritus fueris, conduplicaverit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 31</bibl>: tenebrae conduplicantur, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:14:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 14, 24</bibl> (Trag. v. 412 Rib.).—Humorously: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora, of a loving embrace (cf. conduplicatio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
condurdum: <entryFree id="n10057" type="main" key="condurdum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condurdum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n10057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>: Saponaria vaccaria, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 5, 14, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conduro: <entryFree id="n10058" type="hapax" key="condu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-dūro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n10058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to harden, to make very hard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:969" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 969</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
condus: <entryFree id="n10059" type="hapax" key="condus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>condo</etym>, <sense id="n10059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who lays up</hi> (provisions), opp. promus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
condyloma: <entryFree id="n10060" type="greek" key="condy^lo_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condylōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kondu/lwma</foreign>, <sense id="n10060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a swelling in the parts about the anus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 18, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 30, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 224" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 224</bibl> and 225 al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:143 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 20, 83, § 143 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
condylus: <entryFree id="n10061" type="greek" key="condy^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">condylus</orth> (‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">condŭlus</orth>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=38:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 38, 14</bibl> Müll.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/ndulos</foreign>. * <sense id="n10061.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The knob</hi> or <hi rend="ital">knuckle of a joint;</hi> esp. <hi rend="ital">plur., the fist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">complicatis in condylos digitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 88</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10061.1" n="II" level="1"> (<hi rend="ital">A joint of a reed;</hi> hence meton.) <hi rend="ital">A reed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:78:30" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 78, 30</bibl> dub.—* </sense><sense id="n10061.2" n="III" level="1"> = anulus, Paul. ex Fest. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
conecto: <entryFree id="n10062" type="main" key="co_necto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnecto</orth> (less correctly, <orth extent="full" lang="la">connecto</orth>, v. Ritschl, Opusc. II. 448 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:17:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 17, 8</bibl>), <itype>nexŭi, nexum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>necto</etym>, <sense id="n10062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tie, bind, fasten</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">join together, to connect, entwine, link together</hi> (class.; most freq. in <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi> and the trop. signif.); constr. with <hi rend="ital">cum, inter se</hi>, the <case>dat.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">absol</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10062.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">id (palliolum) conexum in umero laevo,</quote> <trans><tr>folded, gathered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia inter se conexa et apta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:38:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 38, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia omnimodis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 700</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrestria membra marinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 704</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:712" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 712</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:691" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 691</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illae (apes) pedibus conexae ad limina pendent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 257</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:220" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 220</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:5:23" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 430</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia in genibus digitis conexa tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:311" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 311</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves validis utrimque trabibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mosellam atque Ararim facta inter utrumque fossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 53</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Adiabenis conectuntur Carduchi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 15, 17, § 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lata alvus (navium) sine vinculo aeris aut ferri conexa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferreae laminae serie inter se conexae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:9:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10062.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10062.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitia cum voluptate conectitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:77" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita sunt inter se conexa et indiscreta omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:32" default="NO">5, 14, 32</bibl>; cf. * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra historiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:129 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 129 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod discrimini patris filiam conectebat,</quote> <trans><tr>to implicate, involve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam dolori meo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 65</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10062.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., </sense><sense id="n10062.5" n="1" level="3"> In discourse, <hi rend="ital">to connect</hi> with what precedes, <hi rend="ital">join to</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">facilius est enim apta dissolvere quam dissipata conectere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:71:235" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 71, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud non est in uno verbo translato, sed ex pluribus continuatis conectitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:41:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 41, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se pleraque conexa et apta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:39:137" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 39, 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 2</bibl>: verba lyrae conectere, <cb n="CONF" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina secum gracili filo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:227" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res ac verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:58" default="NO">9, 4, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conexa oratio (opp. interrupta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliam majorem insaniam,</quote> <trans><tr>to join to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 116</bibl></cit>; hence also: versus orationesque ejus, <hi rend="ital">to quote, cite</hi>, Treb. Gall. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n10062.6" n="2" level="3"> In philos. lang., = concludo, <hi rend="ital">to annex</hi> or <hi rend="ital">subjoin a logical conclusion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si enim est verum, quod ita conectitur: si quis, etc. ... illud quoque verum est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:6:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 6, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne, quod ipsum ex se conexum sit (e. g. si lucet, lucet) verum esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 30, 98</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">cō-nexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, = conjunctus, <hi rend="ital">connected, joined, cohering together with something</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sive aliud quid vis potius conexius (quam animus) ei (sc. corpori) fingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:555" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 555</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Silanum per adfinitatem conexum Germanico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 43</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so also without affinitas, of relationship: Caesari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 50</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 66: insequitur magno jam tunc conexus amore Patroclus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 174</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10062.7" n="2" level="3"> In time, <hi rend="ital">immediately following</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conexi his funeribus dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 5, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnexum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conn-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a necessary consequence, inevitable inference</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa ratio conexi, cum concesseris superius, cogit inferius concedere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 30, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primumque quod est in conexo ... necessarium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:7:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 7, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 15</bibl>: quod Graeci <foreign lang="greek">sunhmme/non a)ci/wma</foreign> dicunt, alii nostrorum conjunctum, alii conexum dixerunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:8:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 8, 9</bibl>; cf. the context.—And <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnexē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conn-</orth>), <hi rend="ital">in connection, connectedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 4, § 387</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conexe: <entryFree id="n10063" type="main" key="co_nexe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnexē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. conecto <sense id="n10063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
conexio: <entryFree id="n10064" type="main" key="co_nexi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnexĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conn-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conecto</etym>, t. t. <sense id="n10064.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A binding together, close union</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">scutorum, armorum (in a testudo),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 12, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 9, 517</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n10064.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n10064.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An organic union;</hi> cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=35:13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 35, 13</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">animae et corporis nostri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118, 7, § 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10064.3" n="B" level="2"> In philos. lang. (almost confined to Quint.), <hi rend="ital">a conclusion, a logical sequence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:17" default="NO">17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:19" default="NO">19</bibl>; 22 sq.—* </sense><sense id="n10064.4" n="III" level="1"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">a syllable</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 1</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
conexivus: <entryFree id="n10065" type="hapax" key="co_nexi_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnexīvus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conn-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serving to unite, copulative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjunctio (atque),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:29:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 29, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conexus: <entryFree id="n10066" type="main" key="co_nexus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from conecto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10067" type="main" key="co_nexus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōnexus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">conn-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>conecto</etym>, <sense id="n10067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joining together, combination, connection</hi> (several times in Lucr., elsewh. rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:556" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 556</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 1, 5</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 634</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:726" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 726</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1020" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 1020</bibl>; 5, 443.</sense></entryFree>
confabricor: <entryFree id="n10068" type="hapax" key="confa_^bri^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fā^brĭcor</orth>, <itype>ātus, āri</itype>, <sense id="n10068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep., to compose, make</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">originem vocabuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:19:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 19, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
confabulatio: <entryFree id="n10069" type="main" key="confa_bu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confābŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>confabulor</etym>, <sense id="n10069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a conversation, a discoursing together</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 9:84" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 9, 84</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 2, 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
confabulator: <entryFree id="n10070" type="main" key="confa_bu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confābŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who converses</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Dei,</quote> <trans><tr>with God</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Cant. Cantic. 4, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ep. 2</bibl>, ad Gal. 4, 8.</sense></entryFree>
confabulatus: <entryFree id="n10071" type="hapax" key="confa_bu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fābŭlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a conversation</hi> (cf. confabulatio), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
confabulor: <entryFree id="n10072" type="main" key="confa_bu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fābŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus, āri</itype>, <sense id="n10072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a., to converse together, to discuss something with one</hi> (ante-class. and colloq. for colloquor): <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 76</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 10</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquam accedere Confabulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 107</bibl></cit>: de aliquā re, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:11:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 11, 5</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem magnam cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
confacio: <entryFree id="n10073" type="gloss" key="confa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-făcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make together</hi>: confecerunt = unā fecerunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=59:2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 59, 2</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
confamulans: <entryFree id="n10074" type="hapax" key="confa^mu^lans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fămŭlans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [famulor], <sense id="n10074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serving together</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17, 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confamulus: <entryFree id="n10075" type="main" key="confamu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-famŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n10075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-servant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> H. E. 1, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confarreatio: <entryFree id="n10076" type="main" key="confarre^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confarrĕātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>confarreo</etym>, <sense id="n10076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient solemn manner of marrying among the Romans</hi>, in which was an offering of bread [far] in the presence of the Pontifex Maximus, or Flamen Dialis, and ten witnesses (opp. diffarreatio), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:112" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 3, § 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 140</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg.
