G. 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Verg. A. 4, 339</bibl> and 374; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2648</bibl>; Dict. of Antia. <pb n="411" /> <cb n="CONF" /></sense></entryFree>
confarreo: <entryFree id="n10077" type="main" key="confarre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-farrĕo</orth>, no <sense id="n10077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>farreus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to connect in marriage</hi> (by making an offering of bread; cf. confarreatio; <cit><quote lang="la">very rare): confarreandi adsuetudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum confarreatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 4, 374</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confarreatis parentibus geniti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrimonium confarreaturus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 252, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
confatalis: <entryFree id="n10078" type="hapax" key="confa_ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fātālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <sense id="n10078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., jointly dependent on fate, decided by fate;</hi> the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">suneimarme/nos</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">copulata res est et confatalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:13:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 13, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
confectio: <entryFree id="n10079" type="main" key="confecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conficio</etym> (several times in Cic.; elsewh. rare). <sense id="n10079.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A making, preparing, producing, arranging, composing, completing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus libri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">annalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:12:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 12, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:51:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 51, 116</bibl></cit> dub. (B. and K. consectio, v. Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">olei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 6, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:7:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>an exaction</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamenti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 6, 23, 27</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n10079.1" n="B" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">that which is prepared, made</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 17, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10079.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A diminishing, destroying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">escarum,</quote> <trans><tr>a chewing, masticating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:134" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 134</bibl></cit>: valetudinis, <hi rend="ital">a weakening, impairing</hi>, id. Hortens. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 269, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confector: <entryFree id="n10080" type="main" key="confector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n10080.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A maker, preparer, finisher</hi> (rare): coriorum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a tanner</hi>, Firm. Math. 3, 9, 7: <cit><quote lang="la">purpurae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a dyer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:44:section=108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 44, § 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totius belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux et exercitus tanti belli confector,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:39 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 39 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10080.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A destroyer, consumer</hi>: cardinum, <hi rend="ital">he who breaks them</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 268, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">confector et consumptor omnium ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:15:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 15, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferarum,</quote> <trans><tr>a slayer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 12</bibl>; cf. conficio, II.</sense></entryFree>
confectorarius: <entryFree id="n10081" type="gloss" key="confecto_ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confectōrārĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">confectūrā-rĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>confector</etym>, <sense id="n10081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who slaughters, a butcher</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3672</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4167</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confectorium: <entryFree id="n10082" type="gloss" key="confecto_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confectōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xoirosfagei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n10082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place where swine are slaughtered</hi>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
confectrix: <entryFree id="n10083" type="hapax" key="confectrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confectrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>confector, II.</etym>, <sense id="n10083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which destroys, a destroyer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetustas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 11, 5</bibl></cit> (after a passage of Cicero).</sense></entryFree>
confectura: <entryFree id="n10084" type="main" key="confectu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confectūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conficio</etym>, <sense id="n10084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making, preparing</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">mellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chartae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 23, § 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caerulei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 13, 57, § 162</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
confectus: <entryFree id="n10085" type="main" key="confectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from conficio.</entryFree>
confercio: <entryFree id="n10086" type="main" key="conferci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fercĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n10086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>fertum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>farcio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to stuff</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cram together, to press close together</hi> (in <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> very rare; in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> and <pos>P. a.</pos> class.). </sense><sense id="n10086.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Verb. finit.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus cum confercit, franguntur montes nimborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se (apes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:35" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">myrrham in follis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 15, 35, § 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10086.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viā sibi inter confertas naves factā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo magis astu Confertos ita acervatim mors accumulabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1263</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">agrestem in arta tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 6, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">confer-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a.;</hi> lit., <hi rend="ital">pressed together;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n10086.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pressed close, crowded, thick, dense</hi> (opp. rarus): caeruleum spumat sale confertā rate pulsum, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 5, p. 659</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 379 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">tune inane quicquam putes esse, cum ita completa et conferta sint omnia, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 40, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plures simul conferti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:34:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 34, 12</bibl></cit>: in confertā multitudine, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 369</bibl></cit> (conjunctum, Serv.): <cit><quote lang="la">moles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 62</bibl></cit>.—Esp., </sense><sense id="n10086.4" n="2" level="3"> In milit. lang., of the <hi rend="ital">close, compact</hi> order of battle: <cit><quote lang="la">ut numquam conferti, sed rari magnisque intervallis proeliarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 16</bibl></cit>: acies, Auct. B. Afr. 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 29, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:59:5" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 59, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 347</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 27, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 60:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 60, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 98:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 98, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turmatim et quam maxume confertis equis Mauros invadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 101:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 101, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conferto gradu inrupere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10086.5" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">abl., stuffed, filled full, full</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenti turbā conferta deorum templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">otiosa vita, plena et conferta voluptatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 10, 23</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:19:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 19, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio conferta maniplis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:390" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 390</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">confertē</orth>, in acc. with A. 2. (for the more usual confertim, q. v.), <hi rend="ital">in a compact body;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">confertius resistentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 7, 7</bibl></cit>. <cb n="CONF" /></sense></entryFree>
confermento: <entryFree id="n10087" type="hapax" key="confermento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fermento</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n10087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to leaven, ferment through and through</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confero: <entryFree id="n10088" type="main" key="confe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confĕro</orth>, <itype>contŭli, collātum</itype> (conl-), <itype>conferre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n10088.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bring, bear</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">carry together, to collect, gather</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n10088.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ligna circa casam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:114:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 114, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibos ore suo (aves),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:6:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undique collatis membris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 3 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarcinas in unum locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">collatis militaribus signis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut premerer sacrā Lauroque collatāque myrto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo (sc. in proximum horreum) omne rusticum instrumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illuc (sc. in castella) parentes et conjuges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes in corpore (canes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam omnem, antequam dicere ordiamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:9:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summas (scriptorum) in commentarium et capita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plura opera in unam tabulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae in proximos quinque libros conlata sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, prooem. 1: res Romanas Graeco peregrinoque sermone in historiam, Just. pr. 1; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 44</bibl>; cf. I. B. 5. infra.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogus inimicis collatus manibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 115 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10088.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n10088.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To collect money, treasures</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">for any object, to bring offerings, contribute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dona mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contulit aes populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:351" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 351</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so freq. on monuments: AERE CONLATO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3648</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">EX AERE CONLATO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3991</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum argentumque in publicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 36, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera ei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributa quotannis ex censu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:53:section=131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 53, § 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conferre eo minus tributi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in commune,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:59:section=145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 59, § 145</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadringena talenta quotannis Delum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Arist. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Arist. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(pecunia) ad ejus honores conlata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 25, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad honorem tuum pecunias maximas contulisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:65:section=157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 65, § 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sextantes in capita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:33:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 33, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum alius, alius mel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:7:3" default="NO">47, 7, 3</bibl> pr.: <cit><quote lang="la">sua bona in medium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:6:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 37, 6, 1</bibl></cit> pr.: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam partem patrimonii alicui rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:5" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum et Socrati collatum sit ad victum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 7, 9</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos dabimus, nos conferemus, nostro sumptu, non tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 39</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10088.4" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sumfe/rw</foreign> (v. Lidd. and Scott in h. v. 5.), <hi rend="ital">to be useful, profitable, to profit, serve, be of use to</hi> ( = prosum; cf. also conduco, II.; post-Aug., and only in the third person; most freq. in Quint.); constr. with <hi rend="ital">ad, in</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">dat., inf.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10088.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturane plus ad eloquentiam conferat an doctrina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:19:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 19, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:1" default="NO">2, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:7 al" default="NO">3, 6, 7 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12</bibl>, prooem. § 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 4</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n10088.6" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rursus in alia plus prior (exercitatio) confert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10088.7" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gracchorum eloquentiae multum contulisse matrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; so id. prooem. § 6; 2, 9, 2; 3, 7, 12 al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 23, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:261" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 23, 98, § 261</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:13" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 1, 6, § 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10088.8" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">subj. inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incipiente incremento confert alterna folia circum obruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 26, § 83</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum veteres etiam Latini conferunt, imprimis copiam verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:16" default="NO">2, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:123 al" default="NO">4, 2, 123 al.</bibl>; cf. Sillig ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 67</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10088.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring into connection, to unite, join, connect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">membris collatis, of an embrace,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1101</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 161, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes e quibus collatae aquae flumen emittunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:11:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: capita, <hi rend="ital">to lay heads together</hi> (in conferring, deliberating, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:12:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 12, § 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45, 7</bibl>: pedem, <hi rend="ital">to go</hi> or <hi rend="ital">come with one</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 41</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">gradum ( = congredi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 3, 3, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 488</bibl>.—Of chemical union: <cit><quote lang="la">dissimiles et dispares res in unam potestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10088.10" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">collatis viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 14, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">conferre vires in unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 19, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collata omnium vota in unius salutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:23:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 23, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e singulis frustis collata oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:9:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut studia inter nos conferebamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 1.— So esp. of conferences, consultations, etc., <hi rend="ital">to consult together, confer, consider</hi> or <hi rend="ital">talk over together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid res feret, coram inter nos conferemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitudines nostras inter nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att 5, 21, 12</bibl></cit>: familiares sermones<cb n="CONF" />  cum aliquo, <hi rend="ital">to unite in familiar conversation with</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 11, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hoc in viā sermonem contulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo aut sermones aut consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:15:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 15, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia ad adulescentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 64</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia dispersim antea habita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injurias,</quote> <trans><tr>to deliberate together concerning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 15</bibl></cit>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 15, 2</bibl>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes sapientes decet conferre et fabulari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—With a <hi rend="ital">rel.clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fusi contulerimus inter nos ... quid finis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi conferentibus, quid animorum Hispanis esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 20, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10088.11" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">join together in a hostile manner, to set together</hi> (most freq. in milit. lang.): <cit><quote lang="la">(Galli) cum Fontejo ferrum ac manus contulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 5, 12</bibl></cit> (1, 2): <cit><quote lang="la">signa cum Alexandrinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:21:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 21, 49</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">collatis signis depugnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:23:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 23, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 11, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">arma inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra cum hoste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 12, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">castra castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 28, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 23, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:55:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 55, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedem cum pede,</quote> <trans><tr>to fight foot to foot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pede conlato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 12, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 29, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:39:12 al" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 39, 12 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradum cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:33:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 33, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora luctantia nexu pectoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 242</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stat conferre manum Aeneae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:678" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 678</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima movet Cacus collatā proelia dextrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:569" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 569</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collatis cursibus hastas conicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:270" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seque viro vir contulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:735" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 735</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter sese duri certamina belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra conferre manu certamina pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:843" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 843</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collato Marte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 379</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mecum confer, ait,</quote> <trans><tr>fight with me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:603" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 603</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10088.12" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> from milit. affairs to lawsuits: pedem, <hi rend="ital">to encounter, come in contact with one, to attack</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non possum magis pedem conferre, ut aiunt, aut propius accedere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:19:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 19, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedem cum singulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 51</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui illi concedi putem utilius esse quod postulat quam signa conferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lites,</quote> <trans><tr>to contend, quarrel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10088.13" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring together for comparison, to compare;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">cum, inter se, ad</hi>, the <case>dat.</case>, or <case>acc.</case> only. </sense><sense id="n10088.14" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem cum eo (sc. Democrito) conferre possumus non modo ingenii magnitudine sed etiam animi?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 23, 73</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:52:section=115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 52, § 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non conferam vitam neque existimationem tuam cum illius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>, § 45; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 26, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum maximis minima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:Or. 6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. Or. 6, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:2 al" default="NO">8, 4, 2 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostras leges cum illorum Lycurgo et Dracone et Solone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:44:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 44, 197</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illa cum Graeciā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; v. also <foreign lang="greek">d</foreign>. —</sense><sense id="n10088.15" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vitam inter se utriusque conferte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 20</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n10088.16" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bos ad bovem collatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 28</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n10088.17" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora praesentia praeteritis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parva magnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui illud,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:50:151" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 50, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanam tinctam Tyriae lacernae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:75" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenia ingeniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5:33" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam puellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:5:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:4:9" default="NO">1, 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil jucundo amico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Pausanias et Lysander) ne minimā quidem ex parte Lycurgi legibus et disciplinae conferendi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 22, 76</bibl></cit>; cf. supra, <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <case>acc.</case> only: <cit><quote lang="la">tesseram hospitalem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conferte Verrem: non ut hominem cum homine comparetis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:54:section=121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 54, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:696" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 696</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec cum quaereretur gener Tarquinio, quisquam Romanae juventutis ullā arte conferri potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 39, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">census,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 159</bibl></cit>.—Of documents: <cit><quote lang="la">haec omnia summā curā et diligentiā recognita et conlata sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:77:section=190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 77, § 190</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10088.18" n="5" level="3"> With the idea of shortening by bringing together (cf. colligo), <hi rend="ital">to compress, abridge, condense, make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be brief</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam potero in verba conferam paucissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in pauca, ut occupatus nunc sum, confer, quid velis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem in pauca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 68</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">in pauca verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 75</bibl></cit>; id: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:4:109" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 4, 109</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam Academiam ... ex duobus libris contuli in quattuor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in pauca conferam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua verba in duos versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:162" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex immensā diffusāque legum copiā optima quaeque et necessaria in paucissimos libros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 44</bibl></cit>.— <pb n="412" /> <cb n="CONF" /> * </sense><sense id="n10088.19" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To join in bringing forward, to propose unitedly</hi> (as a law; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fero, II. B. 8. b.): cur enim non confertis, ne sit conubium divitibus et pauperibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 4, 9</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.</sense><sense id="n10088.20" n="II" level="1"> (Con intens.) <hi rend="ital">To bear, carry, convey, direct a thing somewhere</hi> (in haste, for protection, etc.); and conferre se, <hi rend="ital">to betake</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turn one's self anywhere, to go</hi> (very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n10088.21" n="A" level="2"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n10088.22" n="1" level="3"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10088.23" n="(a)" level="5"> With the designation of the goal: quo me miser conferam? Gracch. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:56:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 56, 214</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum se suaque omnia in oppidum Bratuspantium contulissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se suaque eo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se suaque in naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2, 7 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter Brundisium versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: iter eo, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 13, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suas rationes et copias in illam provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: legiones in mediam aciem, Auct. B. Alex. 39; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Afr. 60: quos eodem audita Cannensis clades contulerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentes illuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se Rhodum conferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:56:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 56, 213</bibl></cit>: se Laodiceam, Lent. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 14, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se Colonas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo se fusa acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16, 1 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad Tissaphernem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 5, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">se ad Pharnabazum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Con. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: sese in pedes, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 518, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 1, 7</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">conicere se in pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>).—Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">pituita eo se umorve confert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10088.24" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulcre haec confertur ratis,</quote> <trans><tr>is borne away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10088.25" n="2" level="3"> Esp., in Ov. M. (cf. abeo, II.): aliquem in aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to change into, transform to something</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in saxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 278</bibl></cit>: versos vultus (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> circumlocution for se) in hanc, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:348" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 348</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus in albam volucrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:145" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 145</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10088.26" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10088.27" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to bring, turn, direct something to;</hi> and conferre se, <hi rend="ital">to turn, apply, devote one's self to</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo mortuo me ad pontificem Scaevolam contuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Crassus) cum initio aetatis ad amicitiam se meam contulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:81:281" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 81, 281</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 29, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui se ad senatūs auctoritatem, ad libertatem vestram contulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 9, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad studium scribendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad studia litterarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">meus pater eam seditionem in tranquillum conferet (the figure taken from the sea when in commotion),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: verba ad rem, <hi rend="ital">to bring words to actions</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to pass from words to deeds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspitionem in Capitonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:35:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 35, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut spes votaque sua non prius ad deos quam ad principum aures conferret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lamentationes suas etiam in testamentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 68</bibl></cit>.—More freq., in partic., </sense><sense id="n10088.28" n="2" level="3"> With the access. idea of application or communication, <hi rend="ital">to devote</hi> or <hi rend="ital">apply something to a certain purpose, to employ, direct, confer, bestow upon, give, lend, grant, to transfer to</hi> (a favorite word with Cic.). </sense><sense id="n10088.29" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dona quid cessant mihi Conferre?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi munera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:3:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoribus praemia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellae quinquaginta milia nummūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructum alio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:6:1:section=24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 6, 1, § 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10088.30" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostiles exuvias ornatum ad urbis et posterum gloriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mithridates omne reliquum tempus non ad oblivionem veteris belli, sed ad comparationem novi contulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne studium atque omne ingenium ad populi Romani gloriam laudemque celebrandam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 9, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem meam curam atque operam ad philosophiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem tuum amorem omnemque tuam prudentiam ... confer ad eam curam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum ad fodiendos puteos, Auct. B. Alex. 9: ad naturae suae non vitiosae genus consilium vivendi omne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:33:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 33, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem omnem ad misericordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10088.31" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes curas cogitationesque in rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligentiam in valetudinem tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedas ac manubias suas non in monumenta deorum immortalium, neque in urbis ornamenta conferre, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:23:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 23, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eos, quos speramus nobis profuturos, non dubitamus officia conferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 15, 48</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">plurimum benignitatis in eum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 16, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 19, 70</bibl>: curam restituendi <cb n="CONF" /> Capitolii in L. Vestinum confert, i. e. <hi rend="ital">assigns to, charges with</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in unius salutem collata omnium vota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:23:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 23, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10088.32" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">erga</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commemoratio benevolentiae ejus, quam erga me a pueritiā contulisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10088.33" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">aliquid ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in aliquem</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aliquid, to refer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ascribe something to</hi> a person or thing as its possessor, author (in a good, and freq. in a bad sense), <hi rend="ital">to attribute, impute, assign, ascribe to one, to lay to the charge of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">species istas hominum in deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:27:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 27, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res ad imperium deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permulta in Plancium, quae ab eo numquam dicta sunt, conferuntur ... Stomachor vero, cum aliorum non me digna in me conferuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 14, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis illius invidiam in L. Flaccum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suum timorem in rei frumentariae simulationem angustiasque itinerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua vitia et suam culpam in senectutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc ego de re publicā disputationem in Africani personam et Phili contuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 16, 2</bibl></cit>.—So esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 156</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 2</bibl>, a, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">causam in aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 31, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 11, 6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">causam in tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:61:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 61, 228</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10088.34" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To transfer to a fixed point of time, fix, assign, refer, appoint, put off, defer, postpone</hi> (cf. differo): <cit><quote lang="la">Carthaginis expugnationem in hunc annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: in posterum diem iter suum contulit, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 13, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia in mensem Martium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in ambulationis tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam pecuniam in rei publicae magnum aliquod tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:24:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 24, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in longiorem diem conlaturus fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus consulatum in annum aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:61" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 61</bibl></cit>.—Rarely of place: <cit><quote lang="la">idoneum locum in agris nactus ... ibi adventum expectare Pompei eoque omnem belli rationem conferre constituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 81 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10088.35" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To bring on, cause, occasion, induce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candorem mollitiamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 50, § 175</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conferrumino: <entryFree id="n10089" type="main" key="conferru_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-ferrūmĭno</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ferūmĭno</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n10089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to cement, to solder together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 45, § 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conferte: <entryFree id="n10090" type="main" key="conferte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confertē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. confercio, <sense id="n10090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
confertim: <entryFree id="n10091" type="main" key="confertim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confertim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>confertus, A. 2.</etym>, <sense id="n10091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a compact body, closely;</hi> in milit. lang., of marches, battles, etc. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sese recipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 50:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 50, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et pugnant et cedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:43:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 43, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 8, 9</bibl> Weissenb. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
confertus: <entryFree id="n10092" type="main" key="confertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from confercio, q. v.</entryFree>
conferumino: <entryFree id="n10093" type="main" key="conferu_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-ferūmĭno</orth>, v. conferrumino.</entryFree>
conferva: <entryFree id="n10094" type="main" key="conferva"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conferva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conferveo</etym>, <sense id="n10094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of water plant</hi> (so called on account of its healing power), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 45, § 69</bibl> (in <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 59</bibl> called consolida).</sense></entryFree>
confervefacio: <entryFree id="n10095" type="main" key="conferve_fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confervē-făcĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make glowing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">melting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes aurumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 353</bibl></cit> (Lachm. conferve facit).</sense></entryFree>
conferveo: <entryFree id="n10096" type="main" key="conferve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fervĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n10096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to seethe, boil together</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n10096.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10096.2" n="II" level="1"> In medic. lang., of broken limbs, <hi rend="ital">to heal, grow together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 10, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
confervesco: <entryFree id="n10097" type="main" key="confervesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confervesco</orth>, <itype>ferbui</itype> (cf. ferveo, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 866</bibl> P.), 3, <sense id="n10097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [conferveo], <hi rend="ital">to begin to boil, to become heated, grow hot</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n10097.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10097.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">aër conclusus versando confervescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">granum, si tegulis subjaceat, confervescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:302 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 30, 73, § 302 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n10097.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: mea cum conferbuit ira, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 71</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10097.4" n="II" level="1"> In medic. lang., of broken limbs, <hi rend="ital">to heal, grow together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quando ossa non conferbuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 10, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 8, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confessio: <entryFree id="n10098" type="main" key="confessi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confessĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>confiteor</etym>, <sense id="n10098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a confession, acknowledgment</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10098.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (in good prose; esp. freq. in Cic. and Quint.), with <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">errati sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 17, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignorationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 12, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inscitiae suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captae pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:53:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 53, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 18, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 27, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paenitentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:76" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 19</bibl></cit>. —In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad vos indicia, litteras, confessiohes communis exitii detuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:69:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 69, 145</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea erat confessio caput rerum Romam esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 45, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:47:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 47, 8 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">pron. pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:47:section=104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 47, § 104</bibl></cit>; <cb n="CONF" /> 2, 5, 64, § 166; <cit><quote lang="la">Liv 28, 40, 11: confessionibus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 6, 15</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:40:section=103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 40, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,018:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. Quir. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:43" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa Ciceronis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ipsorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:18 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 7, 6, § 18 al.</bibl></cit>: extera corporum indubitatas confessiones habent, i. e. <hi rend="ital">proofs of the healing power</hi> (of assafœtida), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 23, 49, § 103</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: immo si actionem stultissimasque de se, nefarias de patre confessiones audisses? Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsorum de somno piscium confessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 7, 6, § 18</bibl></cit>.—With abstr. subjects: ea confessionem faciunt, non defensionem, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10098.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n10098.3" n="A" level="2"> As a fig. of speech, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:33" default="NO">12, 1, 33</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10098.4" n="B" level="2"> In eccl. Lat. </sense><sense id="n10098.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A creed, avowal of belief</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidei, Greg. M. Ep. 7, 5: nostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10098.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An acknowledgment of Christ</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10098.7" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 10, 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10098.8" n="(b)" level="5"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">an acknowledgment of Christ</hi> under torture; and hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">torture, suffering</hi> for religion's sake, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
confessor: <entryFree id="n10099" type="main" key="confessor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confessor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>confiteor</etym> (only in eccl. Lat.; <sense id="n10099.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">opp. negator),</quote> <trans><tr>a confessor of Christianity, a martyr</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 17 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
confessorius: <entryFree id="n10100" type="main" key="confesso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confessōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>confessor</etym>; in the jurists, <sense id="n10100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to confession</hi> or <hi rend="ital">acknowledgment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:4" default="NO">8, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:23" default="NO">9, 2, 23</bibl>; 9, 2, 25 al.</sense></entryFree>
confessus: <entryFree id="n10101" type="main" key="confessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confessus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from confiteor.</entryFree>
confestim: <entryFree id="n10102" type="main" key="confestim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-festim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>kindr. with festinus, festino, from fero</etym>, <sense id="n10102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">immediately, speedily, without delay, forthwith</hi> (class. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">abi ad thensaurum jam confestim clanculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem administrandam arbitror sine ullā morā et confestim gerendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confestim aut ex intervallo aliquid consequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:28:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 28, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 12, 42</bibl>: sequi, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 176</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">insequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 340</bibl></cit> (315); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se subsequi (cohortes) jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 3, 2</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">huc advolavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:67:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 67, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:31:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 31, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 7, 12</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">alacres admittier orant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 231</bibl></cit>; * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pandatariam festinavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Hostus cecidit, confestim Romana inclinatur acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 10</bibl>.—Cf. upon this art. Hand, Turs. II. p. 103 sq.</sense></entryFree>
confestinatio: <entryFree id="n10103" type="spur" key="confesti_na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-festīnātĭo</orth>, a false read. for cum festinatione, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 233</bibl>.</entryFree>
confetasus: <entryFree id="n10104" type="gloss" key="confe_ta sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confēta sus</orth>, <sense id="n10104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sow offered in sacrifice with all her young</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=57:21" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 57, 21</bibl> Müll. (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 43</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
confexim: <entryFree id="n10105" type="main" key="confexim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confexim</orth>, v. conficio <sense id="n10105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
confibula: <entryFree id="n10106" type="hapax" key="confi_bu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fībŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n10106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wooden double cramp, clincher</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligneae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conficiens: <entryFree id="n10107" type="main" key="confi^ci^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confĭcĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, v. <itype>conficio</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
conficio: <entryFree id="n10108" type="main" key="confi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, fectum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n10108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> confexim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 39</bibl>; in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, besides the regular form conficior, freq., but not in Cic., in acc. with fīo, fieri: <cit><quote lang="la">confit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 291</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:15:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:83" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 7, 40, § 83</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 14, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">confiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:738" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 738</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 219</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">confiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:929" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 929</bibl> Lachm.: confiant, Imp. Leo, Cod. 2, 7, 11: confieret, Balb. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 15</bibl>, A, 3; 9, 7, A, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:50:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 50, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">confierent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">confieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1069" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1069</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:889" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 889</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 58</bibl>; Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 116</bibl>; v. Forbig. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 59</bibl>; cf. Neue, Formenl.
