II. p. 611), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>facio</etym>. </sense><sense id="n10108.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To make a thing completely ready, to make, prepare, bring about, complete, accomplish, execute</hi>, etc. (except in Quint., freq. in all periods and species of composition). </sense><sense id="n10108.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10108.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi cottidiano sesquiopus confeceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 67</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eme lanam, unde pallium conficiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 93</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">anulum, pallium, soccos suā manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:32:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 32, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:26:section=59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 26, § 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligna ad fornacem,</quote> <trans><tr>to make ready, prepare for</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">conficere atque contexere villos ovium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum et argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 45, § 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta (with molere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulas litteris Graecis,</quote> <trans><tr>to write, draw up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 29</bibl></cit>; <pb n="413" /> <cb n="CONF" /> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">libros Graeco sermone,</quote> <trans><tr>to compose, write</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 13, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and librum Graece,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 18, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:23:section=60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 23, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cato, 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cato, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam partem superiorem orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:28:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 28, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 5</bibl>; Vatin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:40:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 40, 11</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">duella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 254 al.</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 61:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 61, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:28:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 28, 76</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">caedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legitima quaedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phoc. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">residua diurni actus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:78" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 11, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 12</bibl> (14), 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 12, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus rebus magnā curā, multā operā et labore confectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, B, 8: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eas res conficiendas biennium sibi satis esse ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus rebus confectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 46:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 46, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">confecto legationis officio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 103</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10108.4" n="2" level="3"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n10108.5" n="a" level="4"> In the lang. of business, <hi rend="ital">to settle, close a bargain, finish</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu cum Apellā Chio confice de columnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si mihi permisisses, confecissem cum coheredibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Acutiliano negotio quod mihi mandaras ... confeceram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10108.6" n="b" level="4"> Of space or distance traversed, <hi rend="ital">to pass over, accomplish, traverse, go over, make, accomplish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 4:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 4, 4 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tertiam partem itineris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eum. 8, 6</bibl></cit>; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos immensum spatiis confecimus aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 541</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 362</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursum vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus annuos conficit sol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:31:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 31, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 20, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">longam viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeritate incredibili longissimas vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 57</bibl></cit>.—Rarely of space occupied: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta facturi, ut mille passuum conficiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 8</bibl></cit> (14).—</sense><sense id="n10108.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10108.8" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to produce, cause, make, bring about, effect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitudines mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">geminas nuptias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid mali gnato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 5, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus animorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:79:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 79, 324</bibl></cit>.—With two <hi rend="ital">accs.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum auditoris mitem et misericordem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:55:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 55, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reditum alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to procure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 13, 4</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">absol., to be efficient, to accomplish a direct result, be an active cause</hi> (philos. t. t.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliae causae ipsae conficiunt, aliae vim aliquam ad conficiendum afferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:26:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 26, 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10108.9" n="2" level="3"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to complete, finish, end, spend, pass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sexaginta annos confecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:38:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 38, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:52:176" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 52, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum denique judicetur beatusne fuerit, cum extremum vitae diem morte confecerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:22:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 22, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annuum tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem vitae suae cursum in labore corporis atque in animi contentione (just before: ut in amore et voluptatibus adulescentiam suam collocaret),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annuum munus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">biennium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 12, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suas horas (somnus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:89" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequinoctium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:8:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">brumam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 14, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:232" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 63, § 232</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">commissum ac profligatum bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 25, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:15:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 15, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10108.10" n="3" level="3"> In philos. lang., <hi rend="ital">to bring forward</hi> as proved, <hi rend="ital">to show, deduce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conclusio est, quae ex eis quae ante dicta sunt, conficit, quid necessario consequatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 30, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:31:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 31, 53</bibl>; hence, conficior, <hi rend="ital">to follow logically</hi> (from something), <hi rend="ital">to be deduced;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum id perspicuum sit, quod conficiatur ex ratiocinatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:40:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 40, 72</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:22" default="NO">5, 14, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:69" default="NO">9, 4, 69</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:47:87 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 47, 87 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n10108.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to diminish, lessen, weaken an object; to sweep away, destroy, kill, wear out, consume</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10108.12" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes intimi escas conficiunt,</quote> <trans><tr>grind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:134" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 134</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:32:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 32, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 61, § 160</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cibos,</quote> <trans><tr>to digest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:137" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:180 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 68, § 180 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes Conficerent vulgo silvas, arbusta cremarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:905" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 905</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">conficere, omnia igni, frigore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrimonium suum (corresp. with dissipare),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 36, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapiens si fame ipse conficiatur ... vir bonus, ne ipse frigore conficiatur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 6, 29</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse conficior venisse tempus cum possim, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est opere et manu factum, quod non conficiat et consumat vetustas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: quae vetustas est, quae vim <cb n="CONF" /> divinam conficere possit? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:57:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 57, 117</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: sicut fortis equus ... senio confectu' quiescit, <hi rend="ital">impaired, weakened</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 5, 14</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and so very freq.: confectus senectute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 9, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectā, Ov M. 6, 37: cum corporis morbo tum animi dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:40:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 40, 86</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:12:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 12, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis gravibusque vulneribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 60:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 60, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:65:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 65, 1</bibl></cit>.—Without <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut fessos confectosque aggrediantur,</quote> <trans><tr>exhausted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 23, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">confectus et saucius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:947" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 947</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego te hic hac offatim conficiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to cut in pieces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenienses,</quote> <trans><tr>to subdue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:37:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 37, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 28, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 28, 8</bibl>; 41, 12, 3; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 10, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 35, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duos hostium exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 40, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me (sica illa) paene confecit,</quote> <trans><tr>killed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 14, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum Curiatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">saucium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caligulam vulneribus triginta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximam vim serpentium (ibes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:36:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 36, 101</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the killing of animals,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Com. 13 al.</bibl>; cf. confector, II.; <cit><quote lang="la">and in mal. part.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 29</bibl></cit> (v. the passage in its connection).—</sense><sense id="n10108.13" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">conficere aliquem verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(captivos) omnibus notis ignominiisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:61:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 61, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectio non cruda sed multa iteratione mollita et velut confecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidus confectum,</quote> <trans><tr>its influence has ceased, it has set</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 23, 36, § 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:207" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 25, 57, § 207</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10108.14" n="III" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to prepare, provide, procure, to bring together</hi>, = colligo: <cit><quote lang="la">virginem, Quam amabat, eam confeci sine molestiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 6</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">centurias,</quote> <trans><tr>to secure their votes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 5:18" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 5, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suam tribum necessariis suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:18:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 18, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortos mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 37, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibliothecam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum difficili rei publicae tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:21:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 21, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus maximos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">armata milia centum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(serpentum) magnam multitudinem (just before, colligere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat ei de ratiunculā apud me pauxillulum nummorum, id ut conficerem: confeci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permagnam pecuniam ex illā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:52:section=138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 52, § 138</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">conficiendae pecuniae rationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 9, 20</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">confĭcĭ-ens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I.), <hi rend="ital">effecting, causing, producing, efficient</hi> (rare, and only in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:26:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 26, 93</bibl></cit>: corporis bonorum conficientia (<foreign lang="greek">ta( tw=n a)gaqw=n poihtika/</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">productive of physical good</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:27:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 27, 81</bibl> Madv.: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas conficientissima litterarum,</quote> <trans><tr>very carefully noting down every thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 19, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
confictio: <entryFree id="n10109" type="main" key="conficti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>confingo</etym>, <sense id="n10109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inventing, fabricating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 13, 35</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">confictionis argumentatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:11:81" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 11, 81</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conficto: <entryFree id="n10110" type="hapax" key="conficto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conficto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to counterfeit, feign</hi>, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=107" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 107</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
confictor: <entryFree id="n10111" type="main" key="confictor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confictor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who fabricates a thing, a fabricator</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">falsi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> 21, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
confictus: <entryFree id="n10112" type="main" key="confictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from confingo, and from configo.</entryFree>
confidejussor: <entryFree id="n10113" type="main" key="confi^dejussor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fĭdejussor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n10113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joint-surety</hi> (jurid. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:23 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 14, 23 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
confidelis: <entryFree id="n10114" type="main" key="confi^de_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fĭdēlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n10114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fellow-believer</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 9, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confidens: <entryFree id="n10115" type="main" key="confi_dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confīdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, v. <itype>confido</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
confidenter: <entryFree id="n10116" type="main" key="confi_denter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confīdenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. confido, <sense id="n10116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
confidentia: <entryFree id="n10117" type="main" key="confi_denti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confīdentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>confidens</etym>. <sense id="n10117.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A firm trust in a thing, confidence</hi> (thus very rare): scapularum. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 3</bibl>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">confidentia'st inimicos meos me posse perdere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 73</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">occidit spes nostra: nusquam stabulum'st confidentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10117.1" n="II" level="1"> As a quality or habit, <hi rend="ital">self-confidence, boldness;</hi> in a good and bad sense (class.). </sense><sense id="n10117.2" n="A" level="2"> In a good sense (cf. fiducia): confidentia omnis orationis, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 262, 24</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">duas sibi res, quominus in vulgus et in foro diceret, confidentiam et vocem, defuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:30:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 30, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. Non. ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 32</bibl>; <cb n="CONF" /> Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 9</bibl>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n10117.3" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:7:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 7, 14</bibl>, s. v. <itype>confido</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, B.), <hi rend="ital">audacity, impudence</hi>: atrocem coërce confidentiam, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 262, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:ib. 16" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> ib. 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">at confidentiā militia militatur multo magis quam pondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:40:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 40, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:160" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 160</bibl> (opp. fiducia); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 5, 2</bibl>; and metus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confidentiloquus: <entryFree id="n10118" type="hapax" key="confi_denti^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confīdentĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>confidens-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n10118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">speaking confidently</hi> or <hi rend="ital">audaciously;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est confidentiloquius quam urbani adsidui cives, quos scurras vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 164</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
confido: <entryFree id="n10119" type="main" key="confi_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fīdo</orth>, <itype>fĭsus sum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to trust confidently in something, confide in, rely firmly upon, to believe, be assured of</hi> (as an enhancing of sperare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1, 1</bibl>; freq. and class. in prose and poetry); constr. with <hi rend="ital">abl., acc.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, with <case>dat.</case>, rarely with <hi rend="ital">de, ut</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10119.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> (in <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> very rare with personal object): <cit><quote lang="la">aut corporis firmitate aut fortunae stabilitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:14:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiā et facultate causae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum, quo antea confidebant, metuunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturā loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castrorum propinquitate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 75</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 3, 83; Lentul. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 14, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurejurando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:86" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 86</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque milites alio duce plus confidere aut audere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socio Ulixe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 240</bibl></cit> (v. also under <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign>).—So esp. with <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">confisus, a, um: neque Caesar opus intermittit confisus praesidio legionum trium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 106</bibl>; Auct. B. Alex. 10, 5, Auct. B. G. 8, 3; 8, 15; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Afr. 49: tam potenti duce confisus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:42:12" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 42, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullā aliā urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; Lentul. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 15, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patientiā nostrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:68:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 68, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus consulto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:86" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10119.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (so most freq. in all per.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:69:section=177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 69, § 177</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 9, 1 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 17, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 26, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 32, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 40, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 13, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:92" default="NO">11, 1, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 256</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(venti et sol) siccare prius confidunt omnia posse Quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 391</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10119.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (very freq.; <cit><quote lang="la">and so almost always of personal objects): me perturbasset ejus sententia, nisi vestrae virtuti constantiaeque confiderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl>, A, 5; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 9, 2: cui divinationi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his rebus magis quam causae suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:16:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 16, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:28:section=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 28, § 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:64:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 64, 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:23:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 23, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:9:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 9, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:48:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 48, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtuti militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui (peditum parti) maxime confidebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 94</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Afr. 60: fidei Romanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:19:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 19, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 18, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 12, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">40, 12, 15 al.: huic legioni Caesar confidebat maxime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 42</bibl>. —Esp. freq. with <hi rend="ital">sibi, to rely on one's self, have confidence in one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque illi sibi confisi ex portā prodire sunt ausi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum sibi uterque confideret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:23:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 23, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:16:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 16, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 11, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:8:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 8, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:13:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 13, 23</bibl>; Brut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ep. ad Brut. 1, 16, 6</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 14:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 14, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 72:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 72, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 18, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidei legionum, Auct. B. Alex. 6, 2: suae virtuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:67:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 67, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:57:12" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 57, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">felicitati regis sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:14:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecorum erga se benevolentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 10, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:28" default="NO">7, 7, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:9:1" default="NO">7, 9, 1</bibl>; 9, 2, 25; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 81</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 4:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 4, 7</bibl>.—Dub. whether <case>dat.</case> or <case>abl.</case> (cf. supra <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign>): suis bonis. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:13:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 13, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dis immortalibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his amicis sociisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 112:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 112, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis militibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (rebus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:19 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 19 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10119.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">externis auxiliis de salute urbis confidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de consuetudine civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:3:34" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 3, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1, 1</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">confisus avos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:573" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 573</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 18, p. 1185</bibl> P.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil nimis oportet confidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:32:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 32, 78</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 5, 7</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:5:section=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 5, § 16</bibl>, confido is prob. a gloss; v. Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>).—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non confidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 107</bibl></cit>: ubi legati satis confidunt, die <pb n="414" /> <cb n="CONF" /> constituto, Senatus utrisque datur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 13, 9</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n10119.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with inanim. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">remis confisa minutis parvula cymba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:11:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 11, 9</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">confīdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (lit. <hi rend="ital">confident, trusting to something;</hi> hence with exclusive ref. to one's self), <hi rend="ital">selfconfident;</hi> in a good and (more freq.) in a bad sense (class.). </sense><sense id="n10119.6" n="A" level="2"> In a good sense (perh. only ante-class.), <hi rend="ital">bold, daring, undaunted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decet innocentem servum atque innoxium Confidentem esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui me alter est audacior homo? aut qui me confidentior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex, ellum, confidens, catus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod est nimio confidentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:26:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 26, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10119.7" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">shameless, audacious, impudent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui fortis est, idem est fidens, quoniam confidens malā consuetudine loquendi in vitio ponitur, ductum verbum a confidendo, quod laudis est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:7:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: improbus, confidens, nequam, malus videatur, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 262, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0146,001:ib. p. 262:13" default="NO"><author>Turp.</author> ib. p. 262, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 73</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 10, 27</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 1, 3</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 12</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenum confidentissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 445</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendacium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 318, 27</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">confīdenter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n10119.8" n="1" level="3"> In a good sense, <hi rend="ital">boldly, daringly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">confidenter hominem contra colloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 183</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 207</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 6</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:19:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 7, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10119.9" n="2" level="3"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">audaciously, impudently</hi>, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 262, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 3, 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">confidentissime resistens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 5, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
configo: <entryFree id="n10120" type="main" key="confi_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fīgo</orth>, <itype>xi, xum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n10120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: confictus sagittis, Scaur. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 373</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Art. Vet. 2, 11, 4</bibl>; cf. figo <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>), <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n10120.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To join</hi> (by pressing), <hi rend="ital">to fasten together</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sublaminas inter sese,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transtra clavis ferreis,</quote> <trans><tr>to nail together</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulam aculeis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transversaria tigna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 21</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10120.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To pierce through, to transfix</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10120.3" n="A" level="2"> Prop., esp. with a weapon: <cit><quote lang="la">filios suos sagittis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 28, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capras sagittis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:50:126" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 50, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohors confixa multitudine sagittarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 9, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pereunt Hypanisque Dymasque, Confixi a sociis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 429</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 3</bibl>: confixum facere, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:62:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 62, 255</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem cuspide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:621" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 621</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 7, 15</bibl>.—Prov.: cornicum oculos; v. cornix.—</sense><sense id="n10120.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: meminerant, ejus sententiis confixum Antonium, i. e. <hi rend="ital">rendered powerless</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inactive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 7, 18</bibl>: ubi confixus desides, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 89, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducentis confixus senati consultis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 5, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
configuratio: <entryFree id="n10121" type="hapax" key="confi^gu_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confĭgūrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>configuro</etym>, <sense id="n10121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a similar formation, configuration</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
configuro: <entryFree id="n10122" type="main" key="confi^gu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fĭgūro</orth>, no <sense id="n10122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to form from</hi> or <hi rend="ital">after something, to fashion accordingly</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vitem ad similitudinem sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:20:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura lactis, quae ... ex matris etiam corpore et animo recentem indolem configurat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo habitu et aetate singulorum simulacra (deorum) configurata sunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 17, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem ex rebus diversis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 12 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
confinalis: <entryFree id="n10123" type="main" key="confi_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confīnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>confinis</etym>, <sense id="n10123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to boundaries, boundary-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lineae, Auct. Limit. p. 310 Goes.: populi,</quote> <trans><tr>bordering</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 7, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
confindo: <entryFree id="n10124" type="hapax" key="confindo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-findo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n10124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to cleave asunder, divide</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellurem ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:173" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 173</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
confingo: <entryFree id="n10125" type="main" key="confingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fingo</orth>, <itype>finxi, fictum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to form, fashion, fabricate</hi> (class., esp. in a trop. signif.). </sense><sense id="n10125.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">nidos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 32, 47, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favos et ceras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 5, 4, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 7</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 12, 74, § 195</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10125.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to invent, devise, feign, pretend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolum inter sese,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 35</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas dolis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia haec,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsas causas ad discordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid criminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:37:section=90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 37, § 90</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 8, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:42:4" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 42, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam probabilem causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: fronte confictā, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homicidium in se,</quote> <trans><tr>to declare one's self guilty of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:18:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 18, 1</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id cogitatum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 6, 16</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">confingere et comminisci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 8, 12</bibl></cit>. <cb n="CONF" /></sense></entryFree>
confinis: <entryFree id="n10126" type="main" key="confi_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fīnis</orth> (access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">confīnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 11, 16</bibl> B. and K.; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:151" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Pol. p. 144" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Pol. p. 144</bibl> Goes.), e, <sense id="n10126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., bordering one upon another, bordering on, adjoining, contiguous</hi> (class. in prose and poetry, but not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n10126.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n10126.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:16:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 16, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:1:4:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 1, 4, § 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in confinem agrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:49:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 49, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10126.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: confines erant hi Senonibus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio confinis Illyrico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 29, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti quisque potentiori confinis erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 41, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens confinis Cappadociae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mauri Atlanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 15, 29, § 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:718" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 718</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora prato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:924" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 924</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons fundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:20:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 3, 20, § 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10126.4" n="B" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n10126.5" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">confīnis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a neighbor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:35:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 35, § 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:32" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 2, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10126.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">confīne</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which borders upon, a boundary, border, confine, neighborhood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi labentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:649" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 649</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">papillae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:374" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 374</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10126.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">nearly related, nearly like, similar</hi> (mostly postAug.; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in Quint.): pervenire ad confinium genus ejus generis (orationis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 11, 16</bibl></cit> B. and K. (al. confine).— With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">confinia carmina studio vestro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:5:71" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 5, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia virtutibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 120:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 120, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confinia sunt his celebrata apud Graecos schemata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:92" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 92</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:88 al" default="NO">6, 3, 88 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 10:1" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 10, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confinium: <entryFree id="n10127" type="main" key="confi_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confīnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>confinis</etym>, <sense id="n10127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a confine, common boundary, limit, border</hi> (of lands; <cit><quote lang="la">on the contr., vicinitas, of houses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:1:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; class. in prose and poetry; most freq. after the Aug. per.; in Cic. perh. only once; not in Quint.). </sense><sense id="n10127.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n10127.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in confinio consitus ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:16:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 16, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 5, § 74</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 23, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad confinium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 9, 10, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per confinium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 9, 10, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex confinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 20, 44, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad usque confinium cervicis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 149, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10127.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicinitatibus et confiniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 18, 64</bibl></cit>.— More freq. in <case>nom.</case> and <case>acc.</case> confinia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 7 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 275</bibl> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n10127.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">neighborhood, nearness, close connection</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10127.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quam arto salutis exitiique fuerimus confinio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:124:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 124, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">boni malique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:5:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">breve artis et falsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum vitiorum (et virtutum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:4:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10127.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur., confines, boundaries</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">confinia lucis, noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:706" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 706</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 401</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 592</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:187" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 187</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:70" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
confinius: <entryFree id="n10128" type="main" key="confi_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confīnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. confinis <sense id="n10128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
confio: <entryFree id="n10129" type="main" key="confi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confīo</orth>, <itype>fĭĕri</itype>, v. conficio <sense id="n10129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
confirmate: <entryFree id="n10130" type="main" key="confirma_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confirmātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. confirmo, <sense id="n10130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
confirmatio: <entryFree id="n10131" type="main" key="confirma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confirmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>confirmo</etym>, <sense id="n10131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a securing, establishing, confirming</hi> (in good prose, but only in trop. signif.; most freq. in Cic., Caes., and Quint.). * </sense><sense id="n10131.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetuae libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10131.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n10131.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A confirming, fortifying, quieting</hi> of a wavering, fearful mind; <hi rend="ital">encouragement, consolation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ciceronis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim confirmatione nostrā egebat virtus tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10131.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A confirming, verifying of a fact, assertion</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">perfugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:30:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 30, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 12</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10131.5" n="2" level="3"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">an adducing of proofs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:24:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 24, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:8:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 8, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:4:1" default="NO">4, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:79" default="NO">4, 2, 79</bibl>; 5, 14, 6 Spald. al.</sense></entryFree>
confirmative: <entryFree id="n10132" type="main" key="confirma_ti_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confirmātīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. confirmativus <sense id="n10132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
confirmativus: <entryFree id="n10133" type="main" key="confirma_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confirmātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>confirmo</etym>, <sense id="n10133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">serving for confirmation, confirmative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adverbia (profecto, scilicet, quippe, etc.), Prisc. pp. 1020 and 1056 P: conjunctio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 411</bibl></cit> ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1032</bibl> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Abrah. 2, 11, 89</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">confirmātī-vum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an affirmation, affirmative</hi>: duo negativa confirmativum faciunt, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:127" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:457" default="NO">6, 457</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">confirmā-tīvē</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1149</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
confirmator: <entryFree id="n10134" type="main" key="confirma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confirmātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who confirms</hi> or <hi rend="ital">establishes a thing;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n10134.1" n="I" level="1"> Pecuniae, <hi rend="ital">a surety, security</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 26, 72</bibl>: venditionis, Jul. Epit. Nov. c. 3, § 10.—</sense><sense id="n10134.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erroris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
confirmatrix: <entryFree id="n10135" type="main" key="confirma_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confirmātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>confirmator, II.</etym>, <sense id="n10135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who establishes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">confirms a thing</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 4</bibl>; Jul. Vict. Art. Rhet. 4, 2 MSS. <cb n="CONF" /></sense></entryFree>
confirmatus: <entryFree id="n10136" type="main" key="confirma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confirmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. <itype>confirmo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
confirmitas: <entryFree id="n10137" type="main" key="confirmi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-firmĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n10137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">firmness of will;</hi> in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">obstinacy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 34</bibl> Brix. (the verse is rejected by Lorenz).</sense></entryFree>
confirmo: <entryFree id="n10138" type="main" key="confirmo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-firmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to make firm, establish, strengthen, confirm</hi> (class., esp. in prose). </sense><sense id="n10138.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (prop. and trop.): <cit><quote lang="la">stipites confirmare et stabilire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ali hōc vires nervosque confirmari putant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentis mobilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 49, § 178</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 57" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:59" default="NO">59</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">confirmare et densare defluentem capillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 11, 83, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crus debile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime religando confirmant parietum soliditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castellum magnis munitionibus multisque tormentis, Auct. B. Alex. 21, 5: intestina,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to heal, cure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicatriculam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: se, <hi rend="ital">to recover</hi> physically, <hi rend="ital">to grow well</hi> (corresp. with convalescere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 4, 4</bibl>; 16, 1, 1.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the vine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem et amicitiam cum proximis civitatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
