G. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">confirmare societatem datā ac acceptā fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 44:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 44, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes factionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 32, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">viris suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:44:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 44, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se transmarinis auxiliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjurationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum Persarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Milt. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decreta,</quote> <trans><tr>to confirm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acta Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, C, 12: <cit><quote lang="la">acta alicujus in transmarinis provinciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:44:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 44, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficia edicto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciam a Caesare datam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10138.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n10138.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To confirm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strengthen courage, to instil courage into one, to encourage, inspirit, animate, embolden</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum meum,</quote> <trans><tr>to take heart, take courage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum sapientissimi hominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 24, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximi animi hominem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos ratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 426</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confirmare et excitare afflictos animos bonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos Gallorum verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 46, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacillantium gentium animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:120:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 120, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suos ad dimicandum animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">diffidentem rebus suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">territos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 38, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perterritos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Massilienses obsidione laborantes adventu suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum suum ad virtutem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 22, 31</bibl></cit> Klotz (al. conformavit): <cit><quote lang="la">nepotem suum ad successionem imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc erige te et confirma,</quote> <trans><tr>take courage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ipse te confirmasses,</quote> <trans><tr>hast acquired courage</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 11, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">confirmant ipsi se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:36:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 36, § 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:14 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 14 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos multa pollicendo confirmat, uti Romam pergerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alius alium confirmare, ne nomina darent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 24, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Aliquem alicui rei</hi>: gladiatores Lentulus libertati confirmat, <hi rend="ital">encourages them to freedom</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">incites them to make themselves worthy of freedom</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 14, 4</bibl> dub. (Dinter and Kraner: <cit><quote lang="la">spe libertatis).—With abstr. objects: reliqui temporis spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:22:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 22, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspitionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus rectus et confirmatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10138.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To confirm one in his disposition</hi> or <hi rend="ital">feelings, in his fidelity</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">insulas bene animatas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:120" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 120</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10138.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To confirm, give full assurance of</hi>, a fact, <hi rend="ital">corroborate</hi> an assertion, <hi rend="ital">settle, fix, establish, to prove, demonstrate</hi> the truth of a thing, etc. (very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">confirmare nostra argumentis ac rationibus, deinde contraria refutare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:19:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 19, 80</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. refutare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 2; 5, 13, 53; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opp. refellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:9:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 9, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:45" default="NO">12, 1, 45</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. diluere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confirmare aut infirmare rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:30:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 30, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:32:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 32, 71</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 32, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum omnium testimoniis de hac Dionis pecuniā confirmatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:8:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 8, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen commenticium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec istius vituperatio atque infamia confirmabatur eorum sermone, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:38:section=101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 38, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perjurium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">19: iste locus est tibi etiam atque etiam confirmandus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:32:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 32, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his rebus confirmatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 6</bibl></cit> Kraner ad loc. —With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 185</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2</bibl>, <pb n="415" /> <cb n="CONF" /> 179; 5, 198.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctissimo jurejurando confirmari oportere, ne tecto recipiatur, qui non, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 66 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc idem visum esse ex superioribus castellis confirmaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 67</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ex ipsis caeli rationibus ausim Confirmare, nequaquam esse creatam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 179</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10138.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To assert, affirm, protest something as true</hi> or <hi rend="ital">certain;</hi> constr. with <hi rend="ital">acc., acc.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc cum mihi non modo confirmasset, sed etiam persuasisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talem exsistere eloquentiam non potuisse confirmo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—So with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:17:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 17, 50</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illud se polliceri et jurejurando confirmare, tutum iter per fines suos daturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confirmare, fidem publicam per sese inviolatam fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memini me audire te de glorioso et celeri reditu meo confirmare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—So with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 7, 15</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">confirmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n10138.7" n="A" level="2"> (In acc. with II. A.) <hi rend="ital">Encouraged, courageous, resolute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus certus et confirmatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 24, 77</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sensus rectus et confirmatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confirmatiorem exercitum efficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10138.8" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to II. C.) <hi rend="ital">Asserted, affirmed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus (litteris) erat confirmatius idem illud, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10138.9" n="C" level="2"> (Proved; hence,) <hi rend="ital">Certain, credible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod eo confirmatius erit, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:11:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 11, 35</bibl></cit>: fides confirmatissima, <hi rend="ital">most fixed</hi>, Porph. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 27</bibl>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">confirmātē</orth> (in acc. with I.), <hi rend="ital">firmly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 11, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confiscatio: <entryFree id="n10139" type="hapax" key="confisca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confiscātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>confisco</etym>, <sense id="n10139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forfeiting, confiscation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:9:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. confisco, II. B.</sense></entryFree>
confiscator: <entryFree id="n10140" type="gloss" key="confisca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confiscātor</orth>, <sense id="n10140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a treasurer, master of the exchequer</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">tamiou=xos</foreign>, Vet. Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
confisco: <entryFree id="n10141" type="main" key="confisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confisco</orth>, no <sense id="n10141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>fiscus</etym> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n10141.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To lay up in a chest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (summam) et confiscatam semper repositamque habuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:101" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 101</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10141.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">felices pauperes, qui totam animam in confiscato habent,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in hand, in readiness</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Fuga, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10141.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To seize upon for the public treasury, to confiscate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">HS. milies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alienissimas hereditates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10141.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the person whose property has been confiscated: <cit><quote lang="la">devictis his et confiscatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 15</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">principes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duos equites Romanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:3:9:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 3, 9, § 6</bibl>; cf. confiscatio.</sense></entryFree>
confisio: <entryFree id="n10142" type="hapax" key="confi_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confīsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>confido</etym>, <sense id="n10142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">confidence, assurance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">confisio firma animi (est fidentia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:37:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 37, 80</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
confisus: <entryFree id="n10143" type="main" key="confi_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from confido.</entryFree>
confit: <entryFree id="n10144" type="main" key="confit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confit</orth>, v. conficio <sense id="n10144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
confiteor: <entryFree id="n10145" type="main" key="confi^te^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confĭtĕor</orth>, <itype>fessus, 2</itype> (arch. <sense id="n10145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> confiterier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 22</bibl>), <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>fateor</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to acknowledge, confess, own, avow</hi> (an error, mistake, or a fact previously denied or doubted, etc., implying a sacrifice of will or a change of conviction; while fateor expresses a simple acknowledgment, and profiteor a voluntary avowal), <hi rend="ital">to concede, allow, grant</hi> (class. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">quid confitetur, atque ita libenter confitetur, ut non solum fateri sed etiam profiteri videatur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 9, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: hic ego non solum confiteor, verum etiam profiteor, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 434, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacendo loqui, non infitiando confiteri videbantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sest. 18, 40</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n10145.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10145.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et genus et divitias meas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccatum suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amorem nutrici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 703</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amorem patris nutrici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:11:31" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:8:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: singula, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:86:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 86, 2</bibl>: se, <hi rend="ital">to make one's self known</hi> (sc. Jovem), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 2</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">deam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 591</bibl></cit>.—With two <hi rend="ital">accs.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se victos, Cacs. B. C. 1, 84: se imperitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam Caesaris meliorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc de statuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:60:section=149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 60, § 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summam infirmitatem de se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de se quid voluerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 4, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10145.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc confiteor jure mi obtigisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 97</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me abs te cupisse laudari aperte atque ingenue confitebar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 9, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:7:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 7, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 271</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:826" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 826</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:691 al" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 691 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:85" default="NO">11, 1, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 52</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n10145.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eampse vos audistis confiterier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 9</bibl> (8), <cb n="CONF" /> 46: <cit><quote lang="la">confitentem audire Torquatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:7:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 7, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 270</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:11:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 11, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 318</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">confessae manus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>confessing defeat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 215</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10145.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de maleficio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:41:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 41, 119</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 42, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 59</bibl>; cf. supra, <hi rend="ital">a fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n10145.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">confessus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: aes, Lex XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:13:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 13, 11</bibl>, and 20, 1, 45; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 1, 15</bibl>; v. under <pos>P. a.</pos>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10145.7" n="II" level="1"> Esp., after the Aug. per., sometimes, <hi rend="ital">to reveal, manifest, make known, show.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10145.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">confessa vultibus iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motum animi sui lacrimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admirationem suam plausu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:39" default="NO">9, 4, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidinem coëundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:28:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 28, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n10145.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:122" default="NO">4, 2, 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 7, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n10145.10" n="III" level="1"> In eccl. writers, <hi rend="ital">to confess, own, acknowledge</hi>: Christum, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 5, 40.— With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi, Domine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:137:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 137, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomini tuo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 141, 8</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 15</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">confessus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n10145.11" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act., confessing, that has acknowledged, pleaded guilty</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">reus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:56" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in judicio reus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:4:4:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 4, 4, § 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">confessi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">criminals who have confessed their guilt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de confessis supplicium sumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10145.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, lit., <hi rend="ital">acknowledged;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">undoubted, evident, certain, incontrovertible</hi> (most freq. in the post-Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnes intellegant, quam improbam, quam manifestam, quam confessam rem pecuniā redimere conetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:56:section=130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 56, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confessā in re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 49, 50, § 164</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:116" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 11, 45, § 116</bibl>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">confessum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an undoubted, certain, acknowledged thing, matter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a confessis transeamus ad dubiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:21:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhuc versamur in confessis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de confessis disserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:138 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 49, 70, § 138 al.</bibl></cit>—Hence the phrases: <cit><quote lang="la">ex confesso,</quote> <trans><tr>confessedly, beyond doubt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in confesso esse,</quote> <trans><tr>to be notorious, everywhere known</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:11:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 3, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brev. Vit. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:22:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 2, 22, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:85:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 85, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 8, 34, § 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita cervis in confesso longa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 32, 50, § 191</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in confessum venire,</quote> <trans><tr>to be generally acknowledged, be well known</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 81</bibl></cit> (85), 8; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad liquidum confessumque perducere omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro confesso habere aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
confixilis: <entryFree id="n10146" type="hapax" key="confixi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confixĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>configo</etym>, <sense id="n10146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be joined together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">machina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 148, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
confixio: <entryFree id="n10147" type="main" key="confixi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confixĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a firm joining together</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">dentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:3:6" default="NO">3, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confixus: <entryFree id="n10148" type="main" key="confixus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">confixus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from configo.</entryFree>
conflabello: <entryFree id="n10149" type="hapax" key="confla_bello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-flābello</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n10149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to fan violently;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">scintillas libidinum,</quote> <trans><tr>to kindle</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conflaccesco: <entryFree id="n10150" type="hapax" key="conflaccesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-flaccesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n10150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n., to grow quite languid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus conflaccescunt,</quote> <trans><tr>subside</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:30:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 30, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conflages: <entryFree id="n10151" type="gloss" key="confla_ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conflāges</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-flōges</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-frāges</orth>), <sense id="n10151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">places exposed on all sides to the winds</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=40:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 40, 10</bibl> Muuml;ll.; <cit><quote lang="la">the same in the access. form: ‡ confrages loca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 14, 8, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conflagratio: <entryFree id="n10152" type="main" key="confla_^gra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conflā^grātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conflagro</etym>, <sense id="n10152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a burning, conflagration</hi> (post-Aug. and rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3</bibl>, praef. 5; 3, 28, 7; 3, 29, 1 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 9, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conflagro: <entryFree id="n10153" type="main" key="confla_^gro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-flā^gro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n10153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a., to burn up</hi> (rare; mostly in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n10153.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to burn, be consumed</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10153.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">conflagrare terras necesse sit a tantis ardoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:36:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 36, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis populi Romani praedonum incendio conflagrabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:35:section=92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 35, § 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 7, 9</bibl>: tabulae simul conflagraverant, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:28" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10153.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">an te non existimas invidiae incendio conflagraturum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 11, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 26, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitiorum invidiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:15:section=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 15, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoris flammā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 35</bibl></cit>, § 92; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi conflagrassent Sidicini, ad nos trajecturum illud incendium esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 30, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10153.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (rare; in <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> only late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter Semelen conflagravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 179" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 179</bibl></cit>; cf. Schol. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:63" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 63</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: conflagratus, <hi rend="ital">burnt up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs acerbissimo incendio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 8, 12</bibl></cit> dub.: regiones, App. de Mundo, p. 73, 32.</sense></entryFree>
conflammo: <entryFree id="n10154" type="hapax" key="conflammo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-flammo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n10154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to inflame</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:7:98" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 7, 98</bibl>. <cb n="CONF" /></sense></entryFree>
conflatilis: <entryFree id="n10155" type="main" key="confla_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conflātĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>conflo, II.</etym>, <sense id="n10155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cast, molten</hi> (late Lat.): Juppiter, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 295; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 130</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">con-flātĭle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a molten image</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:27:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 27, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conflatio: <entryFree id="n10156" type="main" key="confla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conflātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conflo</etym>. <sense id="n10156.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fanning, kindling, stirring up</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n10156.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">fornacis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jov. 1</bibl></cit>, n. 1.— </sense><sense id="n10156.2" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a casting, moulding</hi> in metal, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:51:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 51, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10156.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Fug. Pers. 3</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10156.4" n="II" level="1"> = inflatio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:2:36" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 2, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conflator: <entryFree id="n10157" type="main" key="confla_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conflātor</orth> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a metal-caster</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">xwneuth/s</foreign>, Cod. Th. 11, 21, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 6, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">51, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conflatorium: <entryFree id="n10158" type="main" key="confla_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conflātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a melting. furnace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:27:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 27, 21</bibl>; cf.: fornax, conflatorium, <foreign lang="greek">xwneuth/rion</foreign>, Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
conflatura: <entryFree id="n10159" type="main" key="confla_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conflātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a melting of metals by fire</hi> (late Lat. and very rare), Firm. Math. 6, 31.</sense></entryFree>
conflexus: <entryFree id="n10160" type="hapax" key="conflexus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-flexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [flecto], <sense id="n10160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bowed, bent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 44, 44, § 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conflictatio: <entryFree id="n10161" type="main" key="conflicta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conflictātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>conflicto</etym> (postAug.), <sense id="n10161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a striking together, a collision, conflict, struggle</hi>: exercituum duorum, Gell 15, 18, 3; <cit><quote lang="la">for a place in the theatre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 29</bibl></cit> Halm: <cit><quote lang="la">improbissimae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 3, 33, § 8</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 302, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10161.1" n="B" level="2"> Of verbal strife, <hi rend="ital">a dispute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 6, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10161.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A punishing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 7, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conflictatrix: <entryFree id="n10162" type="hapax" key="conflicta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conflictātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>‡ conflictator, from conflicto</etym>, <sense id="n10162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who afflicts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegyptus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
conflictio: <entryFree id="n10163" type="main" key="conflicti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conflictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>confligo</etym> (mostly in Cic. and Quint.), <sense id="n10163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a striking together, a collision.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10163.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">duorum inter se corporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 6</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">a conflict, combat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totius exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7</bibl></cit> (6), 3, 1.— </sense><sense id="n10163.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a contest, conflict</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum contrariarum et dissimilium et inter se pugnantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:16:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 16, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">29, 102</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">30, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:11" default="NO">3, 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:18" default="NO">7, 1, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conflicto: <entryFree id="n10164" type="main" key="conflicto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conflicto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n10164.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to strike together violently;</hi> hence, trop., mid., <hi rend="ital">to fight with, contend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">struggle with</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum ingeniis conflictatur ejusmodi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 66</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cum adversā fortunā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:19:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 19, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">odio inter sese gravi conflictati sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:8:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornibus,</quote> <trans><tr>with the wings of the army</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:3:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>. —Once also <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut conflictares malo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10164.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to strike forcibly to the earth, to ruin;</hi> so very rare in <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui plura per scelera rem publicam conflictavisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fera sese conflictans maerore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 17, 21, § 59</bibl></cit>; but very freq. and in good prose (most freq. in Tac., never in Quint.) in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: conflictari aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to be severely tormented, vexed, harassed, afflicted; to be brought to ruin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos duriore (fortunā) conflictati videmur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judiciis turpibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestiore judicio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstitione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:11:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniquissimis verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:28:section=69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 28, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quibus se putat diuturnioribus esse molestiis conflictatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnis et multis incommodis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 24, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna inopia necessariarum rerum (opp. abundare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravi pestilentiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravi morbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 27, § 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniquā valetudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis difficultatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:22:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 22, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevis tempestatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis aemulis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pervicaci accusatione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 33</bibl></cit>; 14, 50; <cit><quote lang="la">15, 50 al.: foedā hieme,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevissimā hieme,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 57, § 209</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10164.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Without <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ii (sc. milites) tantum conflictati sunt qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 82</bibl></cit>: filia Appii Caeci ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:6:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 6, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conflictus: <entryFree id="n10165" type="main" key="conflictus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conflictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from confligo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n10166" type="main" key="conflictus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conflictus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>confligo</etym>, <sense id="n10166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a striking together</hi> (rare, and mostly in the <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n10166.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n10166.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">conflictu atque tritu lapidum elici ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:9:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:19:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporum (in conflict),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 15, 43</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10166.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">impulse, impression, necessity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatalis incommodi conflictu urgeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:2:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n10166.4" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a fight, contest</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pacat.</author> Pau. ad Theod. 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confligatus: <entryFree id="n10167" type="main" key="confli_ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conflīgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>access. form of <pb n="416" /> <cb n="CONF" /> conflictus, <mood>Part.</mood> of confligo</etym>, <sense id="n10167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">struck together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:3:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit> dub. (al. conflictatus).</sense></entryFree>
confligium: <entryFree id="n10168" type="main" key="confli_gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conflīgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>confligo</etym>, <sense id="n10168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a striking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dashing together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctuum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 9, 9</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: strepente confligio (of the waves), Jul. Firm. Math. praef. p. 1 Pruckn.</sense></entryFree>
confligo: <entryFree id="n10169" type="main" key="confli_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-flīgo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n10169.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (rare), <hi rend="ital">to strike one thing against</hi> or <hi rend="ital">on another, to strike, bring</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">join together, to unite.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10169.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1216</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 98</bibl>, the read. is confulta; v. confultus).—</sense><sense id="n10169.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to oppose in comparison, to contrast</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum adversarii cum scripto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:43:126" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 43, 126</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10169.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to be in conflict, to contend, fight, combat</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10169.4" n="A" level="2"> Prop. (freq. and class. in prose and poetry); constr. with <hi rend="ital">cum, contra, adversus, inter se</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol</hi>. </sense><sense id="n10169.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu cum hoste confligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:23:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 23, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 10, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:22:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 22, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 25, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 57 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 17, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Hannibale acie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 19, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10169.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Contra</hi>: contra sceleratissimam conspirationem hostium, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 13</bibl>, a, 5.—</sense><sense id="n10169.7" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Adversus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus Rhodiorum classem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n10169.8" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad confligendum venientibus undique Poenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:833" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 833</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 9, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 16, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">angusto mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duas aquilas in conspectu omnium conflixisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10169.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">confligunt hiemes aestatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 373</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversi venti Confligunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 417</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n10169.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">causae, quae inter se confligunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illae (naves) adeo graviter inter se incitatae conflixerunt, ut vehementissime utraque ex concursu laboraret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:7:4" default="NO">7, 7, 4</bibl>. —Of a contest in words: <cit><quote lang="la">leviore actione confligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conflo: <entryFree id="n10170" type="main" key="conflo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-flo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n10170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to blow together, to blow up, stir up.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10170.1" n="I" level="1"> Of fire, <hi rend="ital">to kindle, light.</hi> </sense><sense id="n10170.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:11:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40</bibl>, §§ <cit><quote lang="la">138 and 143: incendium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 27, 6</bibl></cit>.—In medic. lang.: <cit><quote lang="la">intestina conflata,</quote> <trans><tr>inflamed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:2:18" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10170.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n10170.4" n="1" level="3"> Of the passions, <hi rend="ital">to kindle, inflame</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conflatus amore Ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:474" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 474</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam inimico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 9, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 12, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 49:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 49, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjurationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 36</bibl></cit>: cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens ac terribile bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:55" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:24:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 24, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10170.5" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to bring about, effect, accomplish, bring together, raise, procure; to produce, cause, occasion</hi>, etc. (a favorite trope in Cic. and the histt.): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus ex rebus conflatur et efficitur id, quod quaerimus, honestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut una ex duabus naturis conflata videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe ex Malo principio magna familiaritas Conflata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem divitiasque sanguine civili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensum communibus motibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 335</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consensus conspirans et paene conflatus,</quote> <trans><tr>melted together, united</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testes odio, invidiā, gratiā, pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriam novo scelere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:74:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 74, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:19:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 19, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:30:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 30, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes alienum grande,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 14, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusationem et judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:47:section=116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 47, § 116</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">judicia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:36:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 36, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egestatem rei familiaris luxuriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cladem hominum generi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1091" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1091</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui periculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui negotium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:54:section=135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 54, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in se tantum crimen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 29</bibl></cit>, § 73.—</sense><sense id="n10170.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (causa pro effectu), <hi rend="ital">to melt, fuse</hi> metals, etc., <hi rend="ital">to melt down</hi> (most freq. after the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">argentum, aes Cyprium et sulphur in fictili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 9, 46, § 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:197" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 56, 57, § 197</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum (fulmine),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:31:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 31, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:7:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 7, § 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra ex argento et auro fabricata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenteas statuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 6, 14, § 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa aurea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronam auream,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falces in ensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:508" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 508</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victorias aureas in usum belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:92" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 92</bibl></cit>: vitrum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">make glass</hi>, Hadr. Imp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Saturn. 8, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
conflorens: <entryFree id="n10171" type="hapax" key="conflo_rens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-flōrens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [floreo], <sense id="n10171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blooming</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flourishing together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 4:4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 4, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confluctuo: <entryFree id="n10172" type="hapax" key="confluctu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fluctŭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n10172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to wave on all sides</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palla,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 258, 27</bibl></cit>. <cb n="CONF" /></sense></entryFree>
confluens: <entryFree id="n10173" type="main" key="conflu^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conflŭens</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">conflŭentes</orth>, v. confluo, I. B.</entryFree>
confluentia: <entryFree id="n10174" type="hapax" key="conflu^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conflŭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>confluo</etym>, <sense id="n10174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flowing together, conflux</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 4, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confluges: <entryFree id="n10175" type="main" key="conflu_ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conflūges</orth> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">places into which several streams flow</hi>: confluges ubi conventu campum totum inhumigant, Liv. And. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 62, 20 sq.</bibl> (v. 16 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
confluo: <entryFree id="n10176" type="main" key="conflu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-flŭo</orth>, <itype>xi, 3</itype> (confluxet = confluxisset, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:987" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 987</bibl>), <sense id="n10176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to flow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">run together</hi> (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n10176.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">materies umoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:637" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 637</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in imum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:498" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 498</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copia materiai Undique confluxet ad imum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:987" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 987</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confluat aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:389 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 389 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fibrenus divisus aequaliter in duas partes cito in unum confluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi Isara Rhodanusque amnes ... confluunt in unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 31, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (portus) cum diversos inter se aditus habeant, in exitu conjunguntur et confluunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:52:section=117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 52, § 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasti amnes e diverso in Phasin confluunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 4, 4, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualis et in curvum pontus confluxerit orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:20" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Panticapen confluere infra Olbiam cum Borysthene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 83</bibl></cit>: a confluente Rhodano castra movi, i. e. <hi rend="ital">where it unites with the Saōne</hi>, Lepidus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 34, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua in rivum confluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:3:20:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 3, 20, § 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n10176.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">conflŭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">conflŭentes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <hi rend="ital">subst. m., the place where two rivers unite, the confluence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad confluentem Mosae et Rheni pervenissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 15</bibl></cit>.—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a confluente supra dicto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 26, 29, § 149</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:3:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 32, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi Anienem transiit, ad confluentes collocat castra,</quote> <trans><tr>at the confluence of the Anio with the Tiber</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epit. 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 31, § 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:40 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 40 al.</bibl>—Hence, <foreign lang="greek">kat) e)coxh/n</foreign>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Conflŭentes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the town of Coblentz, situated at the confluence of the Moselle with the Rhine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:6:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 3, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10176.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of other objects, esp. of a great multitude, <hi rend="ital">to flock</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crowd together, to come together in multitudes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi confluxerunt et Athenas et in hanc urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:74:258" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 74, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfugarum magnus ad eum cotidie numerus confluebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad ejus triremem vulgus conflueret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad spectacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neapolin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plures ad haec studia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undique ad eum auxiliis confluentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:55:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 55, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:80:4" default="NO">2, 80, 4</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo confluens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba undique confluentis fluctuantisque populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:6:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nos dicamur duo Omnium dignissimi quo cruciatus confluant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 48</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n10176.4" n="b" level="4"> With abstr. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">maeror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ipsos laus, honos, dignitas confluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:4:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad nos pleraeque (causae) confluant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:34:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 34, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:741" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 741</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confluus: <entryFree id="n10177" type="main" key="conflu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conflŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>confluo</etym>, <sense id="n10177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing together</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">gurges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 5, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> 18, 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
confluvium: <entryFree id="n10178" type="main" key="conflu^vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">conflŭvĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n10178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a conflux, confluence</hi> (very rare), Varr. ap. Nou. p. 544, 20; Auct. Aetnae, 119 and 326 dub.</sense></entryFree>
confodio: <entryFree id="n10179" type="main" key="confo^di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">con-fŏdĭo</orth>, <itype>fōdi, fossum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n10179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to dig thoroughly, dig round about, to prepare by digging</hi> (orig. pertaining to agriculture). </sense><sense id="n10179.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">terram minute,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:18:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: loca palustria, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 141, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 20, 32, § 142</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n10179.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to strike down by stabbing, to pierce, stab, transfix</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">constituere (Ciceronem) de improviso domi suae confodere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibique pugnans confoditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 60:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 60, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 445</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 176</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:744" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 744</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 11, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:23" default="NO">4, 16, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:22:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 22, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:418" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 418</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 11, 33</bibl> dub. —</sense><sense id="n10179.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (rare; not ante-Aug.): tot judiciis confossi, praedamnatique, = <hi rend="ital">pierced through</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:11:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 11, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala quae vos ab omni parte confodiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 27:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 27, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus causa, quamquam gravissimis criminibus erat confossa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>seriously damaged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit>, abs. 11: quaedam (scripta) notis confodias, <hi rend="ital">you strike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cross out</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 26, 13</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">confos-sus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., pierced through, full of holes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te faciam Confossiorem soricina nenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 48</bibl></cit>. <cb n="CONF" /></sense></entryFree>
